description:
Super delicious and fresh sashimi and sushi (especially the uni - sooo good!!!!!!) Also really particularly loved the udon. It's served in a steamy fishy broth that cleansed your palate very nicely. :-) 

The atmosphere is great and in the front, there are some fun Japanese-style dining tables. Great for both small and large parties. Overall, this is an excellent sushi spot with all the classic sushi items perfected :D (bonus: they offer free valet parking which is a dream in this parking nightmare heck of a city!!)
author: Monica M.

description:
This place is, simply put, just average. I've had dinner here a few times because it's basic, reasonably priced, and easy. However, if you're looking for a fancy dinner or the freshest and highest quality fish, this probably isn't the place. If you're looking for a casual, quick and average sushi dinner, this is your spot. Give it a try! 

They have a lot of different rolls, as well as other entree options. However, I usually stick to the sushi here as opposed to the cooked entree options. The rolls are pretty sizeable and portions are filling!
author: Nicole D.

description:
This is our go to sushi spot as it is close to home and I feel comfortable bringing children here. We went on a busy Friday night - and I mean packed!  They were running and trying to keep up, but were down one cook.  They had a private party in their traditional room with Japanese floor seating (not really that traditional, as you can put your legs down under the table. So the table is close to the floor, but for those Americans (and the elderly) who cannot tolerate being seated in that position they made a cut out under the table so you can sit with your legs extended downwards)...anyway, we waited a looong time for our sushi rolls (which are always tasty) and they were very apologetic and showed real concern. I get it! Shit happens and you can't be a whiny brat! Plus, it helped that they suggested I have another beer on them- yes, having a (free) drink is always a good suggestion ;-)...and they comped our seaweed salad. They were more than gracious, and it was endearing. 

....and as always, the vegetable udon noodle soup with veggie tempura was just fantastic. So go! The food does not disappoint and the service is kind and welcoming.
author: F C.

description: Awesome place with great food and service. My favorite is between the San Francisco roll and 2299 roll
author: Leo L.

description: I love sushi but this was above the rest the chef is awesome very friendly food was incredible never had such a good sushi
author: Patrick W.

description:
Sushi... good
Drinks... good
Soup... good

... but this place has something to offer beyond a decent Japanese meal.  Personality.

At every sushi place I've been to I'm greeted with the generic yelling and shouting... and at first this place too.  But then the next time... they remembered my name.... food... drink... etc.  Good food combined with good company... because doesn't everyone want to go where everybody knows your name? :)

Ps ask for Andy, he's the awesome artist to all these
author: christy c.

description: This place is legit. We had a large group (14) and were seating in the private, curtained-off area with floor seating. Totally worth it to come with a big group since you can freely do sake bombs without upsetting other customers. The prices are impressive, we fed three people and quenched the sake bomb thirst of five for 120. Honestly thought it was going to be around 250, so we were stoked with the turnout. 100% going to return to this place!
author: Sabrina P.

description: Nice neighborhood sushi spot.  Good service and priced appropriately.  Miso was delicious.  Also had the dragon roll which was great.  My first time here and I'll definitely be back.
author: Eric L.

description: Amazing omakase.  Hidden treasure.    Fun sushi chefs.  Hope this place doesn't get uncovered.
author: Bryce Y.

description:
The seasoned edamame was not great at all. 
Miso soup was good
Sushi was pretty good actually! I hate warm sushi so they could have separated the packaging but I would order again. Not necessarily top on my list.
author: Jazmyn W.

description: Salmon Tuna Tartar is really good. Dragon roll is amazing with unagi and I love the crunchiness of tempura. It blends well with Avocado. Service is fast, no wait time. The staff are friendly and efficient. Great sushi and food reasonably price. Free edamame and seaweeds- what can you ask for?
author: Melody D.

description: Delicious sashimi. Ordered it for delivery and it was super fresh and great value for the price.
author: Lisa L.

description: Amazingly delicious sushi. The best variety and fresh fish to boot! I love how the menu is constantly changing. And they have a lot of unique "tasting" options. For example you can get salmon 5 ways and you will taste the highest quality of each type of preparation. Ask for Chef Andy!
author: Debbie M.

description:
Disappointed. The menu said real crab. It wasn't. It was fake crab, And it tasted like tuna salad. I love sushi, but won't visit here again.


Update. I'm told it was real crab. I'm willing to concede that point. It still tasted strange, sweet and mayonnaisy. Perhaps other selections are better. I can't say. I didn't like the Iris roll.
author: Rebecca P.

description:
My favorite neighborhood sushi restaurant by far. Whether a weeknight or weekend it's my go-to spot in the area. 

Andy, the sushi chef, is an absolute magician behind the bar. Tell him to make you something special and you won't be disappointed. He's the man! If you're not a sushi person, their teriyaki is also excellent.
author: Jay F.

description: Lovely neighborhood restaurant! The nigiri is very good quality and the staff is super friendly. chef Andy is a blast! We stopped in on a whim but will definitely be coming back.
author: Laura L.

description:
Great selection, great service. Went here late on Friday night, no problem. 
Dynamite Roll - great
Pink Dragon Roll - super
Unagi fried rice - Delicious 
Tako Sashimi (octopus) - tasty
Owner waited on us and was very attentive.
Food came fast.
author: Jeff W.

description:
We always walk in at the most random times, but are always seated immediately and served promptly. The fish always tastes fresh - even on a Sunday - and the staff is very attentive. You even get free edamame when you sit down! 

Highly recommend the 2299 roll, as well as the Double Hamachi and Kamikaze.

Baked Mussels and Seaweed salad are solid. Also like the Miso Salmon Roll. 

Less into the 49ers roll - i've just had better salmon based rolls.
author: Kylee L.

description: This is around the corner from where I'm staying in San Francisco. Had the Wasabi Roll and Grasshopper Roll. Both were good. Nice and fresh. Nice restaurant.
author: Jason W.

description:
Stumbled across this place while we were walking around the neighborhood on a Tuesday night. No wait in line at 5PM. A pleasant surprise!

Five stars for service and complementary edamame, chicken karaage (for checking in), and ice cream.
To keep it short, food was tasty, prices were very reasonable and fish was fresh. The omakase sushi 10 piece was only $30.
author: Christina G.

description: Mixed review for me here. Service not good and hotate nigiri not fresh at all! Worst ever... The escolar nigiri was great though and the tamago good as well. Doubt I will go back. I heard that edamame was offered to others and I didn't get it offered to me. I saw the reviews where people complained about hot food/sushi mixed. Why can't you figure that out you don't want cooked fish? I hate when they do that, Ugh....
author: Susan F.

description: Fresh fish, great specialty rolls, great oysters and exceptional service! Even the miso soup was better than most. Complimentary small edamame to start which was very much appreciated given how hungry we were. Can't wait to come back!
author: Lauren H.

description: Ordered takeout on Eat24- delivery was delayed so the gyoza was cold but the sushi was excellent. The San Francisco roll was my favorite but the Romeo and Juliet roll was a close second. I've been picky about the sushi here since I moved from the east coast but this place hit the spot.
author: Ashli A.

description: Good quality sushi for the price, great service, super clean. Can't go wrong with this place.
author: Lyle Z.

description:
So apparently Elephant Sushi only takes groups up to four. Needless to say, our group of five ended up on a Friday night at Wasabi & Ginger.

Food breakdown:

2/5 Edamame (Boiled soybean). Granted this was free but the edamame tasted chewy and old. No amount of salt can make that tasty.
3/5 Gyoza (Japanese pot stickers, pork and vegetable inside). These were a-okay. They came out hot but did not taste special or memorable. Next time I would pass.
3/5 Tiger Roll (Shrimp tempura topped with snow crab and crunched honey walnut). My roll was probably the best out of everything our group ordered. I enjoyed the crunched honey walnut but overall thought the roll was pretty mediocre.
4/5 Sake Bombing. I love that our group of friends was able to sake bomb and no one minded! It is such a fun thing to do while you are eating sushi with a large group. The Sapporo was an extra plus :)

Overall, I really appreciate how accommodating the restaurant was being by seating such a large group on a short notice. That being said, the food was a-okay and I probably would not return.
author: Nicole W.

description: Fresh sushi for a great price. Not the fanciest but still really yummy. I live in the area so they remember when I come back and are so nice and neighborly. I definitely recommend the shishito  peppers to start.
author: Lisi D.

description:
Some of the better sushi we've had in the city--which is surprising since there was a big group of obnoxious Marina-kids sitting in the private in-floor dining room at the entrance.

Sushi quality was very good--fiancée loved the tako, amberjack, and toro.  Decent uni.  I really liked the Romeo & Juliet roll which has raw scallops on top, and salmon and avocado on top.

Prices are also very reasonable, at $8-$12 per roll, and $4-$8 for 2 pieces of nigiri or sushi.

They had space on a Friday night at 8:30pm--I think it's because it's outside of the hearts of Pac Heights and the Marina.  Good for us!  This will be a go to spot from now on, and we will definitely be ordering delivery from here.  Yay!

Check in, and get free karage (fried chicken bites).
author: Vanessa O.

description: Such a hit and miss with their delivering. 90% miss. I ordered at 6:30 with a 60 delivery time and it's 8:45 and they have no answer for us. We called twice and both times they said 10 minutes away. Sometimes they would just say hold please and hang up. I had Eat24 call and they weren't even able to get through, line was always busy. We are less than a mile away and I understand that we can easily walk there, or anywhere, and order eat and pay within 2 hours but I DON'T WANNA LEAVE THE COUCH. It's Friday afternoon and I'm tired and cranky hungry me is not great for Yelp reviews.
author: Traci L.

description: My husband and I are visiting from east coast! This place was phenomenal. Tiger roll was probably the best roll I've ever had.... SO GOOD! We enjoyed sake and beer as well. The staff was so accommodating and NICE! That's a huge plus in my book. The atmosphere was also very nice. This will be a spot I remember when I visit San Fran again!!
author: Taylor C.

description: Good value. Good food for that price.  Cozy place, friendly staff.  Good neighborhood restaurant.
author: Portia C.

description:
Ordered because it was free delivery (over $28) and close (.10 miles away) to our hotel. 

Wife ordered some salmon sushi and a rainbow roll...all of the fish smelled and tasted fishy (possible indicator of not being fresh). I ordered shrimp tempura and the rainbow shrimp...BOTH WERE COLD. 

I get they have to deliver, and that the delivery was probably walked over...but then have a way to ensure the food would still be warm. 

But I'm pretty sure it sat for awhile...the styrofoam container it came in had melt marks on it and the side of rice was still warm, which tells me my two shrimp dishes sat for awhile. I would have take. It back but it was late and I didn't want to wait for another hour. I'm not angry...just disappointed. I definitely will not order again when I'm back in town.
author: Frank G.

description: Worst service experience. Didn't even get a chance to make it to the food (though I've been here before and the sushi is....fine.) Tried to dine here for a lovely sushi date night. After being left at the stand for quite some time (in spite of the restaurant not being particularly busy) we were finally seated and then subsequently ignored for another ten minutes. The server finally arrived, but was impatient with our ordering pace and "left to get water," only to return with one glass of water between the two of us and run off before we could put our order in. After sitting for nearly another ten minutes, we flagged down the waiter to ask if we could order only to be - seriously - YELLED at by him, saying "These people were here first." While that was bad enough, he never returned. We walked out after more than 20 minutes of wasted time and went to a much, much better sushi spot (TamashiSoul in case you're looking for a good sushi spot in the neighborhood). I won't be back.
author: Beckie M.

description: Definitely not a bad place to grab sushi but nothing too exciting. They have a good selection of items to choose from but I've not been all that impressed. Tried a few different rolls here and the consistency of the rolls haven't been all that great. I initially blamed it on my subpar chopstick skills but realized that other people were having the same problem as me - the rolls are not tight enough and a few of them crumble when you try to grab them. The California Roll does taste a tad a bid dry as well. However, the service is good and there's never a wait for either take out or dining in.
author: Zoher Z.

description:
I came here with friends because she told me price wise that these guys were better than my regular spot at Ryoko Sushi. So I am not one to turn down an opportunity unless I've tried it once so I figure I'd give it a shot.

Went through a battery of Nigiri and hand roll: Toro Handroll, hamachi toro, black seabream, red snapper, ocean trout. The flavored were decent but nothing mind blowing like other places I've tried. A solid 3.50 on a good day.

The problem came on the order of hamachi hand roll where there was a huge piece of bone that I bit down on. There is one thing that is paramount in any sushi restaurant and that is the proper preparation of the fish to make it suitable for the customer. The largest dishonor for a sushi chef is to fail at the simple prep of remove the bone. For that I have to give you 1 star.  T
author: Christopher C.

description: This is my neighborhood sushi restaurant when I want quick and easy sushi takeout. It's good but they have a bad habit of forgetting things you ordered and quoting you a time for pickup but it's rarely on time. Service could be much better.
author: Cathy B.

description:
I had such a disappointing experience at Wasabi & Ginger recently. 
My boyfriend and I came here for dinner after looking for a nearby place (looking at the Yelp reviews this seemed to be a good choice). We were immediately greeted and sat at the Sushi bar because there were no tables available (totally fine, I actually like sitting at the sushi bar). The waiter greeted us with the complementary edamame and brought ice waters as requested. We were able to put in an appetizer order very quick, but she ran away before we could decide on the rolls. 
APPETIZERS: I went for the seaweed salad. Nothing special, just what you would expect, fresh, simple, decent portion. My boyfriend got Miso soup, unfortunately they served it to him without a spoon causing him to get up and have to track down the waitress before he was able to eat. 
ROLLS: I was surprised to see they have a few vegetarian roll options (yay) but unfortunate that most were tempura (boo). I decided on two rolls (avocado maki & plum/mint leaves) also got the vegetarian gyoza to share. My boyfriend got two rolls (I think the 49ers and the crazy roll). I received my rolls/gyoza first. we were able to share the gyoza and I have my b/f a couple pieces of my rolls as he was waiting. The waitress was no where to be found for quite awhile, only stopping by about 10 minutes after I received mine to say his would be up shortly. Another server dropped off my boyfriends meal about 10 minutes after that, we were not checked up on until we completed our meal. The server never said anything about the long wait or lapse of time in between our meals. Interestingly enough, neither of us were given any wasabi.... or ginger with our meal... which I happen to love. 
Unfortunately we only saw the server again when she came to drop the check, never asked if we wanted another round of drinks or dessert... When she cleared the plates the SPILLED THE TRAY OF SOY SAUCE all over my boyfriends pants and ran away (much like she did for the entire meal) only to come back and run the credit card. 
Overall, very upset with the service here and not entirely impressed with the food either. Possibly this place was just too busy the night we went, but I am not sure I would give it another try.
author: Kelsey B.

description: We ordered the sushi meal for two delivered, it came exactly when it said it would and the fish was very decent quality. Only reason it's a 4, I asked for extra stuff (chopsticks and soy sauce) and I didn't receive it. Not something to cry over though! Good sushi!
author: Meg W.

description: Wow. What a great time here. Our server Liz is sickkkkk, she's the best! Bring your friends and definitely order sake bombs! Simply delish. Sake sake sake bomb bomb...... Bomb
author: Erin B.

description:
I had dinner there a recent rainy night. I had "special" sashimi Miso Salmon, a spicy scallop hand-roll and the teriyaki chicken meal.  

The fish was fresh and the dish tasted good.  

The hand-roll was smaller than what is normally served  and with the scallop portion being minimal. I could barely taste them.   

The meal consisted of a bowl of rice, miso soup and a large portion of chicken.  The rice was perfectly cooked. The miso soup was good and chicken was OK.  I thought it was a little chewy and the teriyaki sauce was decent.

Prices were fair and the service was excellent.
author: Moon S.

description:
Came here last night for a birthday gathering which is a good place for small groups. My go to sushi joint when I lived in the city and same place now out. Lol. 
The waitresses were all very sweet and tentative. Sushi was fresh and rolls were good size. My favorite is the Dragon roll. Love the hamachi collar and carpaccio. Had a bottle of unfiltered sake that I wished I wrote the name down. 
Not sure why all the bad reviews but Im still a fan. Plus free valet parking! Can't beat that in the city.
author: Hanah P.

description: I love this place for delivery at work. They always do a great job prepping the food and does not skip on the quality or portions. Sashimi and sushi is relatively fresh and they do a nice job with the hamachi kama which is a hard meat to grill. Usually no problems at all with timing and friendly service.
author: Ed L.

description:
Came here on a Friday night and was promptly seated at the bar. Food selection and service was excellent! We ordered Dragon roll, Volcano roll, the sashimi specials, uni nigiri, baked mussels, and something jalapeno (?). The jalapeno dish was suprisingly really good! All the food was very tasty and the fish was fresh. 

Oh, checked in on yelp and I got free chicken karaage, which was soooo good!
author: Hang N.

description:
We had a party of four and each one of us ordered a sushi roll. Two out of four were very bland and little to no flavor, the other two were ok. If you do order, get the chef's special. I gambled and ordered the special and my roll was the best out of the four. 
The area is really cute
author: Tanya A.

description:
The salmon sashimi is so fresh here!!! It is delicious and not too expensive. 4 pieces for $8. 

The Romeo & Juliet roll is deliciously topped with spicy mayo. Yum. Good neighborhood alternative to sushi on Polk Street.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Free appetizer with a yelp check in. Free valet parking reasonable priced food.  Good selection of vegetarian options.
author: Sandra S.

description: I've only ordered delivery from this restaurant and I think it's pretty darn good. I ordered beef wrapped in asparagus, chicken teriyaki dinner, salmon skin and shrimp tempura hand rolls. The hand rolls were a bit soggy -- which I totally expected bc it's delivery.  It was still pretty tasty regardless. Teriyaki sauce was great, not too thick or salty (or sweet)!  I think I've found my Japanese take out/delivery place in the city.
author: Esther L.

description: This restaurant is beyond my expectations. I, as a frequent sushi consumer, strongly believe this spot is among the top in the Bay Area. Not only is this restaurant delicious and worth it, but the trendy and modern environment truly sets the restaurant apart. My kids were very happy with their meal, as they ordered miso udon. In fact, the salmon and tuna truly brought every one of my tastebugs alive. Amazing restaurant! Definite recommend!
author: Adrian T.

description:
Miso sea bass is bomb.
Volcano role is bomb.
Miso soup was good.
Do not order: dragon roll, romeo and Juliet

Still need to try the himachi kama.
Will come again

Able to get a table right away at 7:30 on a Thursday but service was still slow.
author: Leland F.

description:
I come here every once in a while because it's down the street from where I live. It's good standard sushi, but wouldn't go out of my way to eat here. 

Prices are average. 

Oh, and you'll never have to wait for a table - which is either good or bad.
author: Kristen T.

description: The Grasshopper Roll and Vege Dragon roll are the reasons I keep coming back. I love finding delicious vegetarian sushi rolls!
author: Stephanie L.

description: So disappointing. I've come back here randomly every few months when I find myself with no other convenient sushi option and always say I won't come back. This is the last time I make that mistake. Long story short: delivery took 1.5 hours and the order was incorrect. I understand they might be busy and have other orders to deliver but, if that's the case, don't tell me it will take only 30 minutes. Also, we got a roll we didn't order that had a fried, unknown meat with what we think had bones in it. Needless to say it was inedible and ruined our dinner. Avoid this place.
author: Roberto F.

description:
Fresh Wasabi is like (I would imagine) crack to me, and thankfully legal and not as harmful. A little dab will do ya. Food was solidly good, and yup its the modern take on the Americanized Japanese food. The long list of rolls which offend some Japanophiles, are the delight of the fans of Wasabi & Ginger. 

Itsa popular joint and rightly so, with valet parking !
author: Matsuo U.

description:
Really good sushi and customer service.
Small little restaurant that many locals come to grab a bite. Not expensive for sushi.
We'll be back !
author: Cynthia G.

description: I had a good time here with my family! We were given complimentary tea and edamame, and then we ordered some rolls, tempura, and karage. The ambiance in the restaurant was nice and calm, and the bathrooms were clean. I'd eat here again!
author: Anastacia M.

description:
A bit off the beaten path, but worth the visit if you're in the neighborhood. Everything I have ever had here is pretty good. I love their California rolls! 
The crowd can get a bit rowdy and I sometimes feel dirty being in the place (can't quite explain what it is), but food is worth it!
author: J C.

description: Tiger roll, gyosa and salmon teryaki delicious!!!! Very good service!!! Very nice place!!!
author: Samantha B.

description:
Delish!!! I'm a huge fan of this place it's a great location in lower PAC/Russian Hill and it's close to a friend of mine. It has happened to be a convenient go-to sushi spot and gas never failed! I've gone now twice and each time was fantastic!

The first time I didn't was after 4th of July and semi late after 9/9:39 and they managed to serve awesome food! The miso soup was great as was the seaweed salad. The rolls were amazing. They all tasted fresh. We particularly liked the Giants Roll and Maui or Hawaiian roll was great. Everything comes out pretty promptly and the servers are really nice. The second time I dined we had a gyoza plate which was SO delicious! Huge fan!!

The sake is good and it's a fun place to order with your meal. It's pretty reasonably priced for the quality of food! I'm a huge san and will continue to go back. It's usually never packed and I've even called first to find out the wait. It's just a great place!!
author: Priya S.

description:
My most frequent go-to for sushi cravings. 

Pros:
1. Free valet parking
2. Great sake choices
3. Very fresh ingredients used
4. Complimentary edamame served before meal
5. Price - Affordable
Note: Free Fried chicken when Yelp check-in!!! Get it!!

Must Try:
1. Butter fish nigiri
2. Romeo and Juliet roll
3. 2299
4. Wasabi roll
5. X-Roll
6. Volcano roll
7. Tea leaf mochi icecream

Not so favorite, to avoid -
Kamikazee rolls 

The rolls are always fresh and deliciously creamy!
author: Payal B.

description: Cheap sushi, great service, and fast! The private rooms are perfect for large parties.
author: Kelsey G.

description: This is a great neighborhood sushi place for my roommate and I. They have free edamame and everything else is reasonably price for fresh and good quality pieces. They also have floor seating which is neat when you go out with a larger group of friends.
author: Aryn V.

description: Sushi is below average. We had the chicken kaarage, volcano sushi, dynamite sushi and the special 2922 sushi and all were blahh.... I would return only because it's literally  downstairs from my place. We had to ask for water numerous times from the host because the waitress was mia. Service was slow and needs improvement! Don't expect great sushi or service.
author: Noor S.

description: I really like this restaurant.  The food is very good and reasonably priced. I had the Prawn tempura and got 4 large prawns.  Most places give you 1 or 2.  The atmosphere is nice and quiet as it is a small place.  Would definitely come here again.
author: Michele M.

description:
New favorite sushi place! Love that they have a free valet parking service, which makes going there so easy. The food is always fresh and the service is amazing. 
 
The best part of it all is that all the food came out very promptly and I love the decor.
They even have a small private area for larger parties. Will definitely go back and I recommend my friends to go and check this place out.

Last notes, the sushi is not only good but very reasonably priced.
author: Diana L.

description:
Been coming here for a few years, and one thing has stayed consistent: top notch quality of their sushi, with fresh fish and interesting specials. I also appreciate their variety of offering, both in terms of rolls (they are awesome) as well as non-seafood items.

I know they get a lot of flak for their service, but I didn't usually pay much attention to that - don't care really. This review is for the good food.
author: Sergei S.

description: I usually like this place, but tonight my delivery order was all wrong. Hot food was cold for starters. The x roll was topped with salmon instead of hamachi and I'm not a huge salmon fan. Disappointed.
author: Jaime J.

description: Surprisingly good considering how it looks from the outside. Service was terrible - not just us but many other tables in the restaurant were begging to be paid attention to or cancelling their orders because everything right down to water refills and a cup of tea was taking so long. Don't bother with the check in and the free chicken - so gross we couldn't even eat it. But the beef asparagus, bacon wrapped shrimp, sushi, miso, chicken teriyaki were all satisfactory. Wanted a very close sushi place after a couple hours at Hot Tubs and this fit the bill.
author: Emily K.

description:
The sushi was fantastic. Service was great. Nice ambiance.

No complaints. but I was pretty faded so maybe that has a factor on my judgement but whatever.
author: Zen T.

description: Super love it!!!! I have been here for dinner for many times! There have great sushi and free valet parking! So great!
author: Chloe G.

description:
2 stars: I would prefer not to come here again. (But I might if I remember to check and double-check.)

I did a pickup order from here. For the main dinner they forgot to put in rice/soup. If you are getting take-out, make sure it's there before you leave.

The sushi rolls were decent, nothing too fancy.
author: Miguel C.

description: Good service i tried the dragon roll was really good. And my father had their teriyaki salmon and loved it
author: Maram Fathi A.

description: I really want to like this place, but there's nothing special that makes this restaurant stand out.  Yes, there's a traditional Japanese seating arrangement in front for seiza (sitting on the ground), but the quality, variety, and service just aren't up to par with nicer sushi restaurants.  I wouldn't consider the fish all that fresh, but it is a great late-night option to satisfy your craving.  I won't rule this place out entirely, but I also wouldn't make this my first choice for sushi.
author: Anthony R.

description: I ate here 10 years ago and I've been dreaming of it ever since. I went back last week on a trip to San Francisco, and they still had the same mouth watering 49er Roll: Salmon with the thinnest slices of lemon on top, rolled with cucumber and avocado. Heaven!
author: Lelia D.

description: Ordered delivery while staying in San Francisco.  Solid Japanese food--not the worst, but not the best.  Really liked how they do delivery.  Would order again, but might check out different choices before going back.
author: Sean U.

description: Great sushi and service. Every time I went there, the servers were very friendly and service was fast!
author: Priscila M.

description:
Ew. For The Love Of God Do Not Order Delivery. 

The the waitress was rude on the phone. 

She told me they made my sushi over half an hour ago. 
It took the delivery boy 90 minutes. he forgot half of my order. 

He had 6 more deliveries. 

Your raw fish will sit inside of a car for 2 hours. 
The worst part is I live 2 minutes away.

They get a star because they refunded me but what did theY refund me?  because they  never even brought half my food. 

Never Eating There Again!
author: Noel H.

description: New York Steak teriyaki was really steak! Heh - it was pretty good and not overdone for me - medium. The rolls all looked very good! It did take a little long to get some of the rolls though. I didn't order any, but I noticed.
author: Michael Y.

description: The food is good, but don't order for take out or delivery, especially on a weekend.  They are horrible at managing their times and ETAs.  My current order is 36 minutes late.
author: Serena Y.

description: It's becoming a Monday night ritual for my girlfriend and I to dine here after our sweat session at the gym.  Every time I drive up and search for parking I forget that there's free Valet service here which makes my dining experience even more enjoyable.  I've tried all their vegetable rolls however my favorite is the vegetarian dragon roll and I replaced the white rice with brown rice.  There's eggplant and friend tempura along with some kind of sweet squash that makes this roll so tasty and delicious.  I enjoy their Agadashi tofu that's cut into perfect little square pieces and battered lightly to perfection.  I'm a nigori fan and their large nigori is under $10. I appreciate that they give you free edamame as soon as you aee seated. The service could be slow but if you wave politely they will come.
author: Sharon N.

description: Order all the specials on the board, as they're the freshest. Chefs are really friendly and helpful at the sushi bar as well. Love this place in the neighborhood!
author: Amy L.

description:
The only time I've ordered from wasabi and ginger is for delivery. 

The sushi isn't bad, especially for the price, however I wouldn't recommend it over other places. It's not the freshest sushi but it does the trick. If you are going to get fish, stay clear of the eel- it's pretty rubbery and doesn't taste fresh from being delivered. The spicy tuna and shrimp tempura is pretty decent!

All in all it's just ok.
author: Jordan S.

description: While they claim to be Japanese food, I would say that no self-respecting Japanese person would come here twice. The sauces that accompany the gyoza, the agedashi tofu, and the tempura are all the same. Either that or they just couldn't bother to give us the right sauces. They all seemed very strong, and more like a Chinese style sauce, than the proper Japanese style accompaniments. We ordered our food to be delivered through Eat24, yet the meal took over two hours and arrived cold, even though the restaurant was only a few blocks away. Not warm, but cold. Since we were in a hotel room, reheating the food wasn't an option.  When I called and asked why it was a half hour past the estimated delivery time they said they were busy, and that the food was on its way. 40 minutes after the phone call, the food finally arrived cold. No call from the driver to say they would be late, no call from the restaurant to say they would be late, and when I contacted Eat24 about the issue via their text feature, no one was answering me.
author: Janet H.

description:
This place is getting better and better! 
It's close to my work, so I've eaten here 5/6 times over the years. It's always been good, but last night it got excellent!
Met a chef we haven't seen before - Albert. He and his partner Charles took great care of us.
Sushimi to die for - toro, hamachi belly, salmon belly! Yum!!! Like butta (LOVE)and generous cuts too.
Uni/ikura tasting spoon!!! Miso salmon!!! 
Albert even treated us to desert - mochi ice cream. Thank you 
Everything was so delish . 
Friendly and very hospitable service. And for the high quality of the fish, truly affordable.
Thanks guys! Just what I needed at the end of a long work day.
Definitely will be back and soon and more often.
5 stars!!!
author: Mumale Z.

description:
I've been coming here for as long as I can remember-- Wasabi & Ginger is conveniently located across the street from where our old dry cleaners used to be (still there but we just sold it!). The owner Ken used to bring us rolls all the time and they were pretty decent! I wouldn't say that they're anything special but I wouldn't say that it's bad, just mediocre.

I like their seafood poki salad though. It's delicious but super teeny so I usually have to order an order of agedashi tofu and finish it by myself. 

I like the small little private area-- it's perfect for a medium sized group looking for some privacy!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
Wasabi & Ginger is awesome, I would eat here every night if I could. (1) The food is good and reasonably priced. (2) They let you sake bomb. (3) They deliver for free. (4) They play the Giants on tv. (5) I don't even like edamame, but they give it to you for free before your meal, which is unusual, but awesome. 

Very, very solid sushi spot.
author: Stephan S.

description:
The location is pretty central and convenient and the valet parking is free (although you may have to wait a while). The restaurant is clean and fairly large and the management/owners are very nice. The prices are fair and the food is pretty good, not great. 

The dishes were put together well but with sushi it's the smaller details that really set a place apart and my sashimi was sliced unevenly and a bit sloppily. The ratios of ingredients in my salad and roll were a bit off. No big mistakes but these small things keep me from giving them a higher rating. 

I was satisfied with my meal hear but not blown away and I feel like it was a good value. I would come here again but I wouldn't label it as a place I must return to.
author: Frank J.

description: This place is amazing ! Seafood is extremely fresh and staff is super helpful and friendly! I would definitely come back.
author: Jessie S.

description:
The fresh wasabi is amazing.
All the ingredients were fresh.
Service was exceptional. All smiling faces :)
Everyone should try this place at least once!
author: Franz C.

description:
I've never been to Japan, but this place makes me think of what I imagine Tokyo to be.  The decor is bright, fun and shiny (and so are the staff).  The music has been 80's New Wave every time I've been here, which is my favorite kind of music.

The menu says something like "contemporary sushi" or "modern sushi.  They have the traditional rolls and nigiri, but also try some different combos that I've never seen before (mostly involving mango).

This place is more like 3.5 stars for me.  I'd love to give them 4 stars, but I just wish they had more specialty rolls that weren't deep fried, combined with mango, or topped off (or combined with) a lot of mayo.

Don't get me wrong.  I love mango!  I also love trying new things.  However, I just can't wrap my head around mango + raw fish.

Oh, I also love mayo and deep fried anything (the X-Roll or Firework Roll are great here), but I'm usually looking for something a little healthier when I'm going to sushi.

They have an extensive sake list and they deliver.  The rice is also good here (not too sour like some places).  Prices are good compared for sushi.
author: Kimberly B.

description: New favorite neighborhood sushi restaurant!  I'm a fan of the edamame they serve you upon sitting down.  Favorites are the sashimi entree, wasabi roll, and Alaska roll.  The fish here tastes very fresh.  The house salad has WAY too much dressing so unless you like your salad drenched, get the dressing on the side. The rice/fish ratio on the sushi is ideal; they don't pack on the rice like some other places.  Service is generally attentive and quick.
author: Andrea L.

description:
Sushi is always fresh, and above average for the price.

On top of that, their customer service is amazing.  If there are any issues or delays, they will comp orders or address it in other ways.  This is always appreciated.

Made some mix up issues when ordering for take out, which is why I only gave them a 4.
author: K G.

description:
Gave it one more chance and was pleasantly surprised.  Food arrived on time and with courteous service.  

Still not great on the order though - most people order soy paper substitute and basically can't eat it if it comes another way.

I would put it this way, if you are picky or have any kinda of allergen I would not order from here.  Otherwise I though it was decent.
author: Alex A.

description:
Wasabi and Ginger is a bit of a staple for my hubs and me since we live close by.  The rolls/sashimi are always pretty good, the house saki is tasty and cheap, and the edamame is free.  Our bill rarely exceeds $60, which overall is a solid price for the area when we're eating and drinking.  

Favorite rolls: super dynamite, giant, and san francisco.

During the giant's playoffs, we ordered the california, san francisco, and giant roll.  They won that night, and kept winning...
author: KF C.

description:
Between the sake + sapporo and other madness it's a miracle I remember this place. 

My only real memory is that the next day I woke up and I was missing $60, which is what I think my tab was. 

My friends were kind enough to recap the experience for me.

Apparently, we had all kinds of rolls, but since I'm such a little bitch I only eat the Salmon/cream cheese rolls. Allegedly, I won't eat anything that sounds "funny."

The waitress was very attentive and catered to our every whim. 

We got that little private room on the left where you can "act a fool" (copyright - Ludacris)  and not have to look at other patrons' disapproving looks.

It was a great place for a party of 13. 

Apparently we roll deep, apparently.
author: Carlos A.

description:
My wife and I had been going here for years.  about once every other week.  after our last experience, we have decided never to go back.  there are too many other options out there to waste your time at this place.  sat at the bar as usual and the chefs never looked up, had to ask for our drinks 3 times from the waitress, and you could just tell they were more focused on to go items than anything.  

truly a sad day in our neighborhood.  can't wait for the new sushi place on polk.  

truly a shame in how we (as locals and regulars) were treated.  

we won't go back and i recommend you go anywhere else.
author: Bill D.

description:
I'm new to SF and I can't believe how hard it is to find good sushi in my area (FiDi).  I made my first attempt to get something out of walking distance and ordered from W&G last night.  

First of all it took 90 minutes for the food to arrive.  Yes, 90.  The sushi was pretty good, but not nothing special.  I thought the salmon was good, but the blue fin nigiri was not.  May give this place another shot, but probably not.
author: Steve K.

description: Love this sushi place it's beyond amazing!! Had the waitresses viola and winy and they were so amazing showed me and my husband what were the specialties on the menu and we loved them! Will definitely be coming back
author: Viktoria Lynn L.

description: Sushi is phenomenal, service is just ...fantastic, they have REAL wasabi! I think this might be my heaven. Definitely my favorite date spot in town. Do yourself a favor and order the baked sea bass and the "butter fish," you can thank me later ;-) Cheers!
author: Danielle L.

description: This is a wonderful sushi venue in the city. Food is really fresh. Awesome service paired with fair pricing makes me want to return. The place itself is comfortable and warm. If you like sushi and sashimi, try this restaurant. The portions are generous and every thing seems to be prepared to perfection. I was amazed at the quality of food, compared to the prices. The quality of food really makes eating here a good value. The plum wine is a good choice.
author: Frank K.

description: This place was delicious!! The live scallop was like butter. Ah-ma-zing! I recommend the albacore toro, the kamikaze roll, and the phoenix were delicious as well. I recommend this place to anyone in the area.
author: Fufff U.

description:
Very fresh fish and lively environment. Very extensive menu from basic rolls to special rolls, to noodle dishes and cooked fish and teriyaki dishes. 
Super fast service, free edamame and good selection of drinks and sake. X-roll and shrimp tempura roll were delicious, as was the Chilean sea bass my boyfriend got. Will return to try more of their menu.
author: Ali M.

description:
I used to live on Jackson and Van Ness and have now moved, but this was my go-to sushi spot for a few years, and it still never fails to disappoint me! The rolls are very fresh and the staff has great recommendations. Also, I think the prices are very affordable. 

My friend I came here on July 4th after a whole day of drinking and were happy to see that this place was open. We each ordered miso soup and to share we got:  large hot sake, seaweed salad, hamachi sashimi (4 pieces), the Hawaiian roll, and the Giant Roll. Firstly, keep in mind that all of this together was less than $50!

Secondly, the portions are generous and the food is AMAZING! The seaweed salad is great for two people, maybe even three. The miso soup was hot and steamy and was delicious. The sashimi I was a fan of because it was only $7 for 4 pieces, and I love that they had the option of getting 4 pieces only (some restaurants make you get more.) I was a little skeptical about the Hawaiian roll at first because the waitress said it was sweet, but I ended up loving the combination with the pineapple in it. The sauce on top was really really yummy too. The Giant roll was so tasty, but I'm also a huge spicy tuna fan! 

When we were done eating, we realized we had a lot the large sake left, so we got a nice buzz at the end of our meal. We were the only two people in the restaurant, so the staff was very attentive and let us sit there 30 minutes after they closed too.

Love this place! :)
author: Priya G.

description: Last summer this place was amazing. Not so much anymore. Too much rice on rolls, sloppily cut fish, and a ridiculous amount of salt on the fresh wasabi. Guessing they lost some of their veteran sushi chefs.
author: Eliot P.

description: I ordered through Grub Hub and the food was so shockingly bad, it was hard to eat.
author: Christine M.

description:
food was decently priced, though i wasn't really looking.  the place is homey looking.

i came here with a group of 20+ for a friend's going away party, and they were SO hospitable and sweet.  we broke some glasses because we were sake bombing.  we were THAT annoying huge group.  we broke a couple glasses.  yes.

still, they were incredibly accommodating!  we were shit faced, and the waitress ordered food for us.  she didn't give us anything super expensive, but just normal appetizers :)  chicken, edamame, simple rolls.

the best part was that later, she gave us half off all the sake we ordered too.  yay!!

i would definitely come here next time with a big group before going out clubbing or to bars even!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Gotta luv the selection and variety of rolls here. Been eating here for almost a decade. Every time I return gotta try a new roll along with some of my favorites. So much on the menu not enough room in the stomach to eat everything. The Sashimi and rolls are what I like to eat the most here but the Teriyaki and Katsu dishes here are pretty good also.
author: T C.

description: I acctually really like it. It's not super special or anything, but it's good value (for the area) and they are really nice. And the food is really tasty. I just always walk out happy.
author: John E.

description:
Friendly service but sometimes really noisy in there!! 
The sushi is really good and the prices are okay! :) I was always satisfied with the food!
author: Carlotta H.

description: Had a group of 18 here, definitely cozy but SUPER fun!!! The sushi is fresh and good, by no means is this the most stellar sushi you will ever have but certainly delicious and an incredible value. Awesome appetizers, every dish we ordered  (and we got a lot) was consistently well made and very tasty. Great beers, great sake, and even better service! I will be doing many more group parties here! GREAT VALUE!
author: Christiane V.

description:
I don't normally review places, but my experience definitely warranted one.

Here it is straight to the point:
-The food was very mediocre, nothing special.

Here is where it gets messy:
We came in with a party of 6. We RARELY saw the waitress. The waitress was extinct from our table. I was wondering why she never came around for the coke that I had requested or to check up on our table. The food took forever to come. I wasn't going to complain, and I was going to give them the benefit of the doubt- but then I heard the party of 6 behind me, who came in BEFORE us, and they still hadn't gotten their food. I knew then that I wasn't the only one disgruntled by this. After a year of waiting to get my food, we finally received the check.

What a surprise: 20% gratuity included. Now it makes sense why the waitress never bothered coming by our table - she was going to collect a smooth 20% anyway.

Gratuity is in place to prevent asshole customers from taking advantage of restaurants when they come in giant groups - I understand this. But to not even bother providing service, just because you know you are collecting a gratuity - that is just BS.
author: Peter K.

description:
The fish is generally quite fresh. Most of the rolls are very tasty. The nigiri is usually a highlight, fresh and good sized portions.

The service is awful - THEY NEED TO HIRE A HOST BADLY. We've waited up with 15 minutes at the entry before even being acknowledged by a staff member. We've waited up to a half hour for our pick up order to be ready, after arriving at the time it was supposed to be ready. There are definitely some major under staffing issues going on in the restaurant.

Since this is my neighborhood sushi place and I really do like the food I've figured out a solution for the bad service. When I place an order for pick up I have them call when it's ready. Instead of waiting for someone to acknowledge me at the entry I walk right up the to register at the bar and pull aside the first staff person I see to ring me up.
author: Lindsay T.

description: Thanks for taking 2 hrs to deliver our food. I could have had a nice meal in a sushi restaurant down the street in much less time.
author: Renee M.

description:
Get the Romeo & Juliet roll! Delicious.
If you like nigiri or sashimi check out what's fresh at the sushi bar. They have some incredible choices.
Decent sake list.
Valet parking - free & awesome.
Service leaves something to be desired.
author: Melinda L.

description: Ordered online and was delivered on time. The food was fresh and tasted great. Got two special rolls.
author: Edgar V.

description:
Wasabi & Ginger is a regular stop for me - especially with groups of friends ~4-8 in size. This place is great sushi for the price and they have a great selection of sake as well.

Among my favorites:
- Boston roll
- Crazy roll
- Chicken Udon
- Green salad (delicious dressing!)

The servers are friendly and accommodating.

The best part - free valet parking!!
author: Kelsey P.

description:
Overall, it's not my "favorite" sushi place, but the pros far outweigh the cons and it's super convenient to my house; not to mention it looks WAY nicer than the local competition (see my other reviews).

Pros:  Good food, fair portions, friendly service, clean restaurant,  and reasonable prices. 

Cons: They charge extra for making a roll "inside-out" and they don't give you free edamame if you're doing a take out order (they do if you sit down).
author: Jake H.

description: I love coming to Wasabi and Ginger.  The sashimi is always fresh.  Miso Salmon Nigiri is to die for.  Uni Ikura tasting spoon is amazing. The chefs, Albert and Charles are super friendly and nice.  Highly recommend it !
author: Galina M.

description:
I love going here to eat.  The food is always tasty and fresh.  The prices are very reasonable for the quality of their sushi.

The decor and ambiance is nice and I like looking at the large fish tanks.

The convenience of free valet parking is also great.  You only need to tip the valet.

The staff are nice and friendly.

Great place for a delicious and satisfying Japanese meal.  Can't wait to go back - BONZAI!!!

P.S.  They are the sister restaurant to Wasabi Bistro in the Castro district.  Their food and service are great too!  

No valet parking though. :(
author: K C.

description: I definitely got the stomach plague after eating here, and spent a lot of money achieving that pain.
author: Lauren V.

description:
I really hate it when people are slow on service but quick to give you the bill.

Food is great don't get me wrong but if appreciate better service please.
author: Abigail P.

description: The udon is the best I ever had...hearty, piping hot, very tasty for a very reasonable price.  The complimentary edamane was a treat.. Service and atmosphere was first rate.
author: Jeff B.

description:
I'm sad to report I've had to change my opinion on my was-favorite neighborhood sushi spot. On our most recent visit I was disappointed with all four of our rolls. The rolls were scarce on fish, lots of rice, and sloppily constructed. As a frequent diner (1/month) I haven't written W&G off completely, but I no longer have as high praise. I hope hope hope we just got the understudy sushi chef. 

On the plus side the wakame salad serving tripled. I would prefer tuna actually in my rolls though.
author: Jacqueline S.

description: um hello my favorite place for sushi ever! The food here is amazing and inexpensive, my two favorite things! It is my hot spot and I love coming here with my hubby for date night. Only place you can get blue shrimp. really awesome food and wonderful service. We even have a party here that was really fun. Never have to wait in line and always good.
author: Angela L.

description: wasabi & ginger is my favorite sushi delivery in the pac heights / russian hill / marina area. prices are reasonable and delivery time is (usually) reasonable. more importantly, the food is consistently good. the sashimi tastes super fresh, and the rolls are delish (i love the kamikaze and philadelphia rolls). they've got a leg up on many of the other local delivery joints - i'd definitely recommend giving them a try!
author: Connie S.

description:
This has become my go-to healthful delivery place.  When I don't feel like cooking but want to stay on dietary course.

You can order online and specify when they'll deliver, but they're pretty consistently 45 mins.  It's kinda nice because your orders are saved in your account so it's easy to remember what you got and liked.  With that in mind...

I've tried about 15 things on the menu... often based on Yelp reviews... and think these are standouts:

- Green salad: fresh, though I use my own balsamic dressing.  One serves two.
- Miso soup: very delish.  Reheat it at home for that piping hot deliciousness
- Vegetarian dragon roll: YOU MUST TRY THIS.  It is the best veggie roll I've ever had and it is the best roll they serve.  CRAYZEE GOOD.
- 49er roll: nice salmon w a little lemon
- Tempura: tasty shrimp and veggies

The GF also loves the salmon sushi.  And when the GF is happy, ev'ybody happy.

Happy and healthy eating!  Kanpai!
author: Scott W.

description:
Pros: Free valet parking. In the neighborhood. Convenient

Cons: Average/Below-Average Sushi & Average/Below-Average Service. Sushi is terrible....Sashimi is better.
author: Kennie B.

description:
WORST delivery service EVER!

If you're going to offer delivery, commit to providing a decent service with timely delivery. otherwise, DON'T OFFER IT!!!

I love their sushi! Much better to dine in. Sushi chefs are amazing and restaurant service is great! Definitely one of our regular go to places. Just don't order for delivery!
author: M L.

description:
My favorite sushi place. Fish is always fresh, generous sashimi portions.
They have Walu-which is super delicious. Pretty good roll selection.

Service is good as well. It does get too loud for my taste on Friday and Saturday nights, but what place doesn't.
author: Mila Y.

description:
The atmosphere leaves a little to be desired, though the chairs are pretty awesome.

The cucumber salad was far underwhelming, but the sushi was good. 

I would totally go back for a sushi meal.

There is also free valet, which is nice.
author: Chloé M.

description: Go-to spot for sushi delivery! Have been ordering here since 2012 and have never been disappointed. Even the sashimi delivery is as good or better than I've had anywhere dining out!
author: Brynley W.

description:
Free valet parking makes this a perfect spot for a casual weekday neighborhood place. 

For me, it gets five stars for excelling at what it is:
-Local sushi place
-inexpensive (2 women splitting one roll, one large beer and a second roll, + miso prob about 25.00)
-Great little sushi bar to sit at, and they will surprise you with the freshest items if you ask. 


The 49er roll is fantastic, perfect size slices of salmon with a small slices of lemon on top. 

I come here about twice a month and I am rarely disappointed. You could easily have a saki b day party here too, as it is good for groups.
author: Danielle V.

description: I love this place. Mmmmm..The food is always delicious as many times as I've dined but some times the service is a little slow. They give you way more time then you need to decide on what to order other then that the staff are all friendly and the food is really good. This is my number one go to date night spotOmg and the mochi ice cream is delicious.
author: Stefany L.

description:
I would definitely recommend bringing your group to Wasabi & Ginger. Ideally, you can get one of the big tables that seat about 10 (or both tables) in the private room in the front of the restaurant. Here, you can sit on the floor and dangle your feet into the pit!

The food is very good and there are tons of choices. I love their sushi and other friends also swear by their chicken teriyaki. There are also tons of great sake choices and some of the very good chilled sake is at quite reasonable prices (about $5-$6 for a small bottle).

I've been to several parties at Wasabi & Ginger before going out on Polk or elsewhere and ten of us will be back there tonight in all our sake-drinking glory! ;)
author: Meghan P.

description:
Wasabi & Ginger is a great little sushi place without the marina dbags you tend to find at the neighborhood's other 'trendy' sushi places. The prices here are also very good. 

We sat at the sushi bar, enjoyed the atmosphere and were able to leave without smelling like fried food. All the rolls we tried were terrific but The Hawaiian was the stand out. The pineapple inside was a nice bright flavor after eating a few richer rolls. I also really liked the miso soup. Salty but not overly salty. We also put down two hot sakes. Delicious! 

 I can't wait to return and try more of their specials.
author: Janell H.

description:
Not the best sushi of my life, but it was good. Service was friendly and very quick, quiet enough to hear the people you're eating with, and prices were average. 

They also have free valet parking (since parking around there can be a hassle!)
author: Christine A.

description:
Over the years this place has been in a steady decline.  The fish is getting fishier, the prices higher, the service crappier, the delivery longer and longer.

Today, I fired them.  

I used to spend way too much money a month on delivery because I hate to cook, it's easy to go low carb, and they would bring my dinner to me.  Yesterday the new delivery boy couldn't figure out how to work my call box (a very normal SF call box) and just left.  I had to call the kid and tell him to come back.

Today I got home from the gym, put my sashimi order in and waited.  Finally I call, and they don't have my order.  The manager has NO idea how to handle an irritated client, doesn't try to appease what I would consider a good client, and blows off both the lost/stoned delivery boy & their failure on their behalf.  

As to the fish - the delivery fish is of less considerable quality to the in house fish.  The walu is rubbery, the salmon skimpy, the albacore becoming atrocious.
author: Taylor T.

description: I've been eating at this restaurant for over half of my life, and have enjoyed every bite. The service there is outstanding and the staff is extremely welcoming. The waiters that work there have always been especially accommodating of my many allergies. This place makes fantastic sushi, and I would most definitely recommend it to all sushi lovers out there!
author: Annabel W.

description:
Omg I'm so glad I discovered this little jem! My boyfriend and I to-goed an X-Roll which contains hamachi, salmon, and avocado. This roll was sooo delicious. We're still raving about how good this roll is. I'm definitely coming back here!

(edit) Came back here the next day to dine at the restaurant and I tried the San Francisco Roll (so delicious!) and the Super Dynamite. The Super Dynamite was tasty but I felt that it was overly spiced. Definitely a tongue burner.
author: Jennie K.

description: I find myself coming back to Wasabi & Ginger whenever I am craving sushi (tonight for instance). Their rollls seem to be a bit bigger since my previous review and their chicken sukiyaki is really good! Service has always been fast and efficient.
author: M W.

description:
Mediocre sushi.  

I came here a bit by accident one Saturday night when we forgot to make reservations in the neighborhood and were starving.  The experience was mediocre all around-- service, food et all. 

The worst part of the meal was the sushi rice.  It was bland, tasteless and  too gummy.
author: Katharine A.

description:
Food: 4 stars
Consistency: 3 stars 
Lack of wait: 4 stars
Freshness: 3 stars

Must get: surf rider roll, california roll, 49er roll, miso soup, house salad, sashimi combo

Free valet, huge tv, lots of seating. Friendly and competent staff.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
sooo just BEWARE, i got sick off the sushi here.

nobody likes you when you're 23....or when you have food poisoning :o(
author: M P.

description:
This is my #1 favorite sushi place in San Francisco.  Not to say there arent other amazing sushi spots but Wasab & Ging is definitely my GO-TO spot.  Best roll is the San Francisco Roll (yum!) and second favorite is the wasabi roll (i love butterfish).

Prices are super reasonable, free valet parking, great food, great service... you can't ask for anything else.

My best friend threw me a surprise birthday here because i love the restaurant so much... Saki Bombing in the front room is BEYOND fun!!!!
author: Lauren P.

description:
We saw a RAT run through the restaurant and into the kitchen while we were eating our meal. The waiter that we told was very nonchalant about it and said "it just happens every once in a while." 

Best to avoid this place, there are plenty of other clean sushi bars in the area.
author: Leo R.

description: Pretty good food. Really really slow service no matter how busy or slow the restaurant is. It's actually very annoying.  The saki bombs are good. If this place had better quality fish and quicker service we would go there more often.  Unfortunate for them there are better options in the marina.
author: Jeremy E.

description: Delish dragon rolls! The food took a while, but my pal and I had miso soup to tide us over. Within walking distance to my hotel. I liked it.
author: Kristin F.

description:
This deserves a solid 3 - 3.5 stars. The fish is pretty good, they offer free ice cream and edamame and you can always get a table. It's definitely a no frills sort of place when it comes to the decor, but this is an excellent go-to option when you want decent sushi, but don't want to deal with a crowd and haven't made a reservation.

I was particularly impressed by the fact that they carry Gluten Free soy sauce. I'm a sushi lover and this is the first place I've encountered that had it, (I usually bring my own along and pull a bottle of soy sauce out of my purse like a weirdo). The staff is knowledgeable, and easily helped me select completely gluten free rolls. The rainbow roll was my favorite, (and they use only real crab meat. A lot of places use a mix which isn't gluten-free friendly). 

I always have a pleasant experience here. Nothing to write home about, but not too shabby either.
author: Mariah M.

description:
I love Wasabi & Ginger. I order the "San Francisco" roll and the "Surf Rider" roll. They bring you free edamame as soon as you sit down. We always order large sake for just $6. 

What I love about this place, aside for the really sweet staff, are the awesome rolls on the menu. There are so many that I would want to try (and have)... but lately I just keep ordering my same two rolls because they're THAT good.

When we don't take a short walk to the restaurant, we often order-in. They have free delivery! They also have free valet which I've done before.

Many people have commented that this place is not very fancy or not much to look at on the outside, but it's a simple place with good food.  It's usually busy but I've never had to wait for a table.
author: Margot G.

description: I've only gotten delivery which has always left me satisfied. I can't say it was anything extra special, but it was yummy and well prepared.
author: Matthew J M.

description:
Good hand rolls, nice ambiance (Giants game on the big screens!) if you want something casual and really attentive service.  Loved the spicy tuna roll they suggested as one of the "house faves," but about died it was so hot. Next time, sauce on the side please. 

Large house sake was your typical $6... had a couple of those. 

Green salad was a little runny on the dressing, but flavor was good. On a thursday night it was pretty busy, but they have valet! We didn't need it as spots were free on Van Ness. 

Loving Wasabi & Ginger  for a casual night out It's my new walkable, neighborhood spot.
author: Natalie N.

description:
Yum! Since this sushi joint is close to our house, we tend to visit often. I love the fact that they have ample veggie items on the menu (yes, we're a couple of veggies who happen to love sushi...so there). 

Their veggie tempura roll is pretty awesome. I also enjoy their avocado roll (after asking them to add cream cheese).
author: Kalie M.

description: It was late when we decided to eat dinner here.  I was craving sushi and my friend suggested W&G. Once I entered, I realized that I have been here before.  Customer service was super friendly and attentive.  I ordered the 49ers roll which had too much rice.  So I ordered hamachi and walu sashimi.  The walu was fresh like butter... oh yeah walu is butter fish, duh?  Hamachi was good after it thawed out a bit.  Overall, not bad especially since it fits the budget... it was girls-night:)
author: Myra M.

description: Came here for a friends birthday party. We were in the "party room" by the entrance. The table set up it pretty cool - sitting on the floor in a sense. Since it was a birthday party we ordered lots of beer and sake. I can't comment much on the food as I don't recall it being phenomenal - nothing was bad. The waitress was attentive and was kind enough to split the bill at the end. I would recommend this place for a small group dinner or a date.
author: Jenna P.

description:
I enjoyed Wasabi & Ginger; solid food, good sashimi, very well prepared edemame, and apparently very well known for their sake bombs, which were also fun.

The servers were decent, a little slow, but perfect for a relaxed chill Sunday dinner.  We didn't want to rush! 

Fried green tea ice cream with melon balls: dessert FTW.  :D
author: Tasha D.

description:
I have been living in the neighborhood for a few years. I used to eat here about twice a month. But I am done. The last three times I have ordered delivery it has taken over an hour - even on a Monday. Not to mention the fact that I live two blocks away.

In addition, the quality of the fish has really gone downhill. Our spicy Tuna roll the last two times we have ordered tasted extremely fishy and was not good. The rest of the fish was mediocre at best - time to look for a new neighborhood joint.
author: Theo Y.

description: I had only been ordering delivery from this place and decided to walk in with a few of my friends last night.  We walked in to sit down and my friend pulled out his chair.  Under the chair was a large dead rat.  We quickly walked out as they swept it into the garbage.
author: Drew C.

description: Not worth the wait.  That's not to say the food was bad.  It was serviceable sushi (although I think there's much better options at that price point in the immediate area).  What made this hard to swallow was the wait.  I came in for a take-out order because I didn't want to make dinner.  I ended up waiting almost a half hour for my meal which was just two simple rolls.  The place wasn't crowded either, with only seven or eight other people seated at the time I placed my order.  The wait was quite frustrating given that I could have just made something much better with less time and cost at home.  Sorry Wasabi & Ginger, but I'll pass next time.
author: Aldo K.

description:
I give this place 5 stars for the price (and great quality of food). Best deal in the city - free edamame and dessert, FREE VALET and fresh sushi. 

Even better, they have Asahi Black (mmmm) which tastes great with their sake. Be sure to try the Fantastic roll- it is pretty...well...fantastic.
author: Karen S.

description:
Nice little neighborhood place, with good sushi & free valet parking. 

This is a great neighborhood place. Yes, there are places with better atmosphere, or better food or better whatever- but stop whining.This place is good, the food is fresh, and they'll park your car for you. 'nuff said.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
Supper fresh and Yummy oyster, sashimi, and hamachi, my daughter love the unagi and tobigo fire rice, very tasted, we also had the tempura and sprider roll,
they were very delicious as well.
I would highly recommend to my friends, "MUST TRY"!
author: Yuri K.

description: Had a fun night with friends here. Good prices for Sushi. The server messed up our order but took care of the mistake and all was forgotten. I recommend getting the Fire Work roll.
author: Jaron N.

description:
Wasabi and Ginger deserves more than the tag "good neighborhood sushi spot," though that's what it is for me just 3 blocks down the street. It certainly looks the part, with the run-down appearance outside, but inside its modern and pretty spacious with comfortable chairs and a big fish tank in the back.

I've gotten the X-roll to go and dining in and it's my favorite specialty sushi roll of all time...(Joe the Man roll at Puzzle a close second). Tuna and salmon on top of a roll with hamachi and avocado topped with spicy mayo make the X-roll a real winner. I like the portion sizes here, generous as sushi places go and the menu is very diverse.

I think my vegetarian non-sushi eating parents would even find something they'd like here, like vegetable yakisoba.

And they must be doing something right, because they were packed the night I went, granted a Saturday night, but they have way more table space than Puzzle or Okoze or Atami. Keep rakin' W&G. I'm a fan.
author: Brian B.

description:
Wasabi & Ginger has been on my radar since 2002 when I lived 2 blocks north of Vallejo.  I always thought about having a dinner there but I already had a favourite sushi spot and when you get hooked on a good sushi place, that's that.  But tonight I just felt lazy and carting my ass all the way to the Richmond via MUNI was simply not going to happen, so Wasabi & Ginger finally got it's shot, albeit 8 years late?

First off, the menu here is a little overwhelming.  Not in the bad grammar and spelling forest for the trees sense, but more of the "Where will I even start?" variety.  At 7pm we were the only table there (suspect) and our server was refreshingly sweet about giving us time to have a browse, choose some drinks, eventually order over 20 minutes after sitting down.  He was honest when asked questions telling us to choose ebi over tako since he thought the tako was chewy. Also, they carry Choya plum wine which is one of the best plum wines in existence.  So, 5 stars for service and setting.

But the food, it was a little average.  It was fresh enough fish, but there was nothing special about the presentation or the flavor combinations.  The wasabi was not strong, which was a little disappointing.  No hair tingling, no heat in the nasal passages, for a place named "Wasabi" this was very disappointing.  The ginger also lacked kick and was not sliced very thinly.  The spicy tuna lacked spice.  The fried oysters were over-breaded and the sauce thick and too sweet.

If I could give them a 3.5 here, I would.
author: Lily A.

description: Casual, comfortable and consistently good neighborhood spot.  If you want fresh and fancy Japanese food without the pretentiousness, this is the place to go.  And in this area, having valet parking is definitely a deal breaker!
author: Anita C.

description: Best sushi place ever. The veggie Dragon roll was delicious.
author: Hector H.

description: The first time I discovered Wasabi and Ginger I was searching for a fun sushi spot to have 10 or so friends get together very last minute on a Saturday night. Most places in the area were booked or couldn't take a group of our size. Not only were they able to accommodate our large group, they gave us a cool private room at the front of the restaurant. Not the best sushi I've ever had, but it's great for sake bombing with a group and comes at a reasonable price. After my great first experience, I've come back a few times and even had a small birthday gathering in the same private room.
author: Jessica W.

description:
OK, aside from offering all the typical rolls you have come to crave when it comes to sushi and making them really well, Wasabi and Ginger also offers sushi made with foie gros.  For me that was the standout of the evening!  

Coming here you know that you can get whatever you crave and it'll taste good, but to find something that I haven't seen elsewhere makes coming here an extra treat! 

Also it's reasonably priced. Another bonus!
author: Denise B.

description:
This new review is for takeout.

California Roll (3 stars): Typical california roll.
San Francisco Roll (5 stars): Yum! Had to get this one again.
Shrimp Tempura Roll (5 stars): Another star roll. Really good.
Fire Work (3 stars): Alright but way too much mayo on top. Not a good choice for takeout because it is deep fried and the sauce topping turns it pretty mushy.

We ordered online and picked it up 15 min later. Nice! 
They have dependable, decent sushi at alright prices. So I think they deserve another star.
author: Melissa H.

description:
Not sure how I have never written a review for this great place! I was fortunate to live around the corner from Wasabi for a year and half, and for awhile there was quite the regular frequenter. It's a great local sushi joint, the staff is very friendly and are great with remembering not only my name but my usual order as well! I only order rolls, but they always seem very fresh and I love their specialty rolls, X-Roll and San Francisco Roll are my favorites! 

I sadly moved a little further away, so do not frequent it as frequently as I would like to, but I always know where to head when I'm in the mood for good rolls and good company :)
author: Lauren S.

description: Not the best sushi, but it was good. It's a sushi restaurant pretty much like any other. Presentation, preparation and quality was average. Ambience is towards "party". Service was friendly and quick. Prices were average.
author: Mario A.

description:
It's a sushi restaurant pretty much like any other. Presentation, preparation and quality is above average. Ambience is towards "party". There's a section for large groups with two of what I can only describe as intimate tables, sunken into the floor.

I'm afraid nothing really grabbed my attention here - it was just all good, and that's something I value.
author: John R.

description:
Wasabi & Ginger has gone downhill, and they are now on my group's "won't return" list for their declined food quality and horrible customer service. 

We ordered delivery recently. 7 rolls and one order of tempura udon. Immediately after unwrapping the food, we realized the udon had chicken. Called back in, explained for 10 minutes and were assured that a new tempura udon was on the way. After examining the rolls more closely, we realized yet another mistake. Called in again, after another 10 minutes we were told that we were mistaken, and it was in fact right. Excuse me, are you looking at this sushi roll or are we? It bore no resemblance to what we ordered. Frustrated, we just gave up.

Udon arrives 40 minutes later. Or so we think. The delivery guy had a box of tempura, but when we tried to give the chicken udon back in exchange for a veggie udon, we realized there was no new container of udon. We were told "No, just pick the chicken out. Extra chicken for you".

100% unbelievable. I think I stood at the door with my jaw dropped while the guy walked away. We've had a lot of fun birthdays at Wasabi & Ginger, but won't be back.
author: Kristina G.

description: This is one of our favorite "everyday" type places.  The food is consistently good, the service is fantastic and friendly, and the pricing is quite reasonable (dare I say cheap?)  They also have complementary Valet parking right in front of the restaurant.  Who else does that in the city - particularly for a moderately priced restaurant?
author: David G.

description:
This is not only my favorite sushi place in the world, but it's ruined me for all other sushi places. For this reason, I have come out of my Yelp Review hole and am determined to finally give the praise Wasabi & ginger deserves.

My boyfriend and I come here almost once a week for their King California roll, Dynamite roll, Crazy roll, and my personal favorite, the San Francisco roll. Yes, we're roll people, but others have told me their sashimi is delicious as well. The decor isn't great but has gotten way better, and the staff is super friendly and accommodating, and they have a great room for parties. Oh, and did I mention the FREE valet parking?

I heard from a lot of locals that the best sushi place in the city was the nearby Zushi puzzle, so reluctantly my boyfriend and I tried it, feeling guilty the whole time, as if I were cheating on my beloved W&G. Thankfully, I disliked virtually everything about Zushi, so I'm happy to say I'm W&G from here on out. 

Thank you to everyone there who have made this place my favorite restaurant in the city!
author: Brooke R.

description: This place would have at least a 3 star if they were more consistent. Overall they have good B average food - ive came here a good handful of times - a couple of times I loved it; some times it was just ok sushi - I wouldn't call it good to recommend  - then this last time I went it was all just a disappointment - All the  sushi and rolls we got was just bland - each time I came here we have ordered about the same variances of sushi and rolls, so the fact that you cannot rely on it being good sushi - well...
author: Rah F.

description:
I go to Wasabi and Ginger all the time. It's kind of a staple of my sushi consumption in the City.

It's a casual place and usually pretty empty on the weekdays. Reasonably priced with good fresh fish. It definitely hits the spot but not your wallet. It's good for big groups or small too.

**Disclaimer- they have a small side room with two tables. You need to reserve that room and they do have a minimum order amount as well as a fixed gratuity on top. I did not know this until the day before my event and had to cancel and move my party out into the main room. Make sure you get all the details when you make the reservation!
author: Abbey S.

description:
Was in SF for the week & stumbled onto this place. It reminded me very much of my fav sushi place, pricing and all. Definitely a once-in-a-blue-moon treat.
Free Valet?! Had to laugh at this since this place is on a quiet corner and looks "what ever" from the outside (but was nice inside).
Free edamame starter, yummmm

Agedashi Tofu- too soft and mushy
