Crazy Roll- how can you make a crunchy roll better? add some tuna! the flavoring of their spicy tuna was fantastic. i usually stick to regular tuna as spicy tuna often has funky additives that drown the natural tuna flavor out. this mix however was a compliment.

Fire Work Roll- the roll its self was absolutely delish!! however, i agree the sauce was a bit too mayo tasting to complete a perfect dish.

X Roll- bland. as much as i like yellow tail, the cut was too large for a roll. may have been better if we liked salmon (asked for it w/o- no price break tho :P)

Super Dynamite Roll- This roll was pretty good, I'll admit that despite me not being a fan of unagi sauce... def was NOT a spicy sauce tho.
author: Sassy-and-Pablo D.

description: Visited this place for many times and can write many positive reviews for them. The service always is exceptional and sushi are tasty. Ask them for that sushi where they paint beautiful ornaments on the plate by colored sauces. It's not just tasty, it's beautiful and I have no idea, how they do that?
author: Serge K.

description:
Talk about some good times at Wasabi & Ginger! Went here recently to have dinner and sake bomb with a bunch of college friends, and we got the private room that's on the left as soon as you enter.

Well first things first, the service was fantastic!  Especially for a rowdy group of 20+, I was very very impressed. The waitress never forgot any request, and was very accommodating.

I feel like I always get the same rolls whenever I go get the sush, but I want to say props to this place for the best veggie tempura roll I've ever had in my life!  The tempera was not soggy or overly greasy, and had the perfect crunch to it.  The roll itself was made with rice paper instead of seaweed and I think it wore it pretty well.  Generally any types of veggie roll are pretty norm, but this one was my favorite EVER.

I also got the Money Train roll that isn't listed on the menu.  It's spicy tuna with seaweed salad on top and it was so delish.  I was swapping out my rolls with the rest of my table the entire night cause they all wanted to jump on the money train! woot woot i don't blame them!

All in all, when i'm back in SF, i will definitely be getting my sushi fill at W&G
author: Liang W.

description:
I had walked by this place so so many times without going in. Last night I decided to try it and I was impressed! I think they should re-paint the outside... in comparison, the inside is way nicer. 

You get some free edemame to start - always nice. 
Then, I had the Giant Roll and crab/avocado, which were both good. Our table also got non sushi items like mussels and stuffed mushrooms that were tasty! I should have tried this place sooner. 

Looked like a fun place for sake bombing.
author: Caitlin B.

description: Not sure if this place has gotten more expensive or I've become more of a cheapskate but the last two times I've come here the food hasn't been worth the price.
author: Peter R.

description:
I came here last night with a friend, and even though they closed at 10, we got there right around then, walked up to the sushi bar and asked if they were still serving.  My friend told me that this was his favorite sushi joint, and they probably recognized him because they said, "no, but for you, okay."

So we sat and ordered tons of nigiri sushi.  Fresh and delicious.  They also gave us some fresh wasabi  to top it off, which was an extra zing with the wasabi and soy sauce that we already had.

The sushi chef was super nice, and they never once rushed us or anything, even though they were closed.  I can't wait to come back here to try everything else on their menu!
author: Tori S.

description:
I had passed Wasabi and Ginger many times while going up Van Ness and always wondered if it was any good. My friend and I came in on a Saturday night thinking it was going to be super chill and empty. We were definitely wrong about that; it was hoppin'! 

My favorite part about my dining experience here was the Vegetarian Dragon Roll: a tempura roll with avocado and eggplant on top. Oh, so good! The rest was pretty standard in my opinion but I will definitely be back for more of those veggie drag rolls....I may even order more than one!
author: Julia N.

description: I guess I understand the low star reviews now... it's sad because this was our easy go-to sushi spot, but the other night two pieces of our nigiri had BONES and another had a scale. I'm not sure if the sushi chefs were just really busy and in a rush or what happened. The waiter asked how everything was and we told him about the bones and scale and he gave us a quick apology but nothing else. Disappointing.
author: Emily C.

description:
One of my gfs took us here for our very first time because she was "tight" with the owner and staff. She said that everytime she eats there, she gets hooked up. Well let's just say we didn't get any hookups.

Staff was friendly.

Food was excellent.

Prices was average for your typical sushi joint.

They're only open for dinner.

Hard to find parking...this is right on Van Ness. They offer valet parking. I can't remember if it was free or not. 

I had my bday dinner here in 2002....I think.  We got one of the private rooms closest by the entrance. It was nice and cozy. Yes, it was a small room and everyone was pretty much packed real close together at the table. But it was nice. This time service was a bit SLOW. it took forever for our food to come.

Haven't been back since. I will one day.

I've decided to break my hiatus and write a review for Wasabi & Ginger since I was very surprised with some of the reviews.  I've visited this establishment a couple of times and was very impressed.  Well let me clarify,  impressed once I finished my meal.  When I first walked in I have to admit I was a little concerned.  It's a bit on the worn side and the decor is, to say the least, interesting.  There is a fishing net nailed to the ceiling with christmas bulbs hanging in no particular order.  The place could definitely use a little updating but this is a prime example of... "never judge a book by its cover".

My sis and bro in-law recommended this place and they have NEVER led me astray so I was certain this place had to be good, but I just couldnt get past the decor, so I was getting nervous.  But we sat down and ordered.  

Oh my god.  It was good.  The kind of good where you need to smoke a cigarette once you've finished.  Yes that good.  We had spicy tuna rolls, red snapper, hamachi, shiro maguro, another white tuna, beef tataki and scallops.  I was in heaven.  I usually don't order red snapper but my husband asked me to try his.  It blew me away.  We ordered more.  Everything tasted incredibly fresh and had a clean yet buttery taste.  The fresh wasabi was delicious, I could not stop.  I threw caution to the wind and I ate it all.  Which says alot, wasabi gives me acid reflux.  But I didnt care I was going to live in the moment and enjoy the spicy flavors against the buttery softness as they burst on my tongue and savor it all.  And of course pay for it later in the evening but it was well worth it.  And I'd do it all again in a heart beat.
author: Anita Y.

description:
I went to Wasabi & Ginger since it is near Julie L.'s casa.  We walked right in and got a table near the back since it was a week night.  Ordered the Super Dynamite, Scallop Lover, Caterpillar, and Naki Toro rolls.  

- The Caterpillar tasted like a roll you get from most sushi joints.  Eel really isn't my thing, but it was good.
- The Scallop Lover was really quite good.  The scallop was lightly cooked and I think mango was in it?  Or something?  I dunno it was good.
- The Toro did not taste fresh or smell fresh.  Major disappointment.  
- The Super Dynamite roll is a spicy tuna roll covered in sriracha sauce.  Spicy tuna is delicious.  Is there really ever a need to drench a perfectly good roll in sriracha?  The answer, if you were wondering, is no.
author: Justine D.

description:
Great fresh fish.
Big slices of sashimi.
Amazing Rolls.
Free Edamame.
Free Valet Parking.
Good Vibe. Sports on the TV. Large Calming Fish Tank.

I love Wasabi & Ginger.
author: Abra A.

description: It's a very unassuming spot but it quickly grew to be one of my favorite sushi places.  Selection is not huge but what they have they do great. Fish is always amazingly fresh and very high quality.  Prices are reasonable, they're rarely full, and service is pretty good.  It may not be the spot to impress your date, but definitely the place for some good sushi without hustle.
author: greg s.

description:
This is one of my favorite sushi joints in the city.  Atmosphere is great, people are chill, sushi is fresh, food is great and presentation is great. Came here for a birthday party the first time, so they can accommodate bigger groups in advance in the main room or book the more traditional looking Japanese side "room" right next to the entrance. 

Weekends are banging and can get crowded, weekday nights seem generally much quieter.  Because of it's location, it's pretty much a local's place-- I must have saw 5 call-in orders while I was there one night, just too bad the neighborhood IS quiet, so not much to walk around to after your meal.
author: Alan P.

description: I've been here many times and the quality of the food is consistent each time I eat here. The rolls are pretty standard with some unique signature roll as well. Also, they will make whatever you would like if you tell them what you would like. The fish is fresh and very tasty. It's never too busy where you have to wait very long for a table. I would say this is one of my favorite sushi places in the city.
author: Hayley H.

description:
The following took place sometime in January 2007,
between 6:37 P.M to 7:04 P.M, weekday.

The man at the sushi bar who suppose to be Sushi chef did not understand the word of "Nigiri".
He kept asking me for roll.
I thought I pronounce right.
"Nigiri."
Maybe my sound of Nigiri was too Japanese?!
No one at the bar didn't understand me ordering sushi, at the sushi bar!
Can I say in Japanese to order sushi?
Or, I can't because this is San Francisco, not in Japan.
But, it's sushi bar.
What's going on?
Soon after, another man came in by runing and I had to order again.
I looked around for a moment and,
No one eating Nigiri at all.

And I saw dust right on the sushi counter!
They did even clean up today.
I should get out there by then.
But it was too late. 
I already ordered.
I made a mistake again.

3 guys at the counter but only 1 man knows Nigiri.
The other 2 are sushi-rollers!
"Maki" only.
What's going on here.

I liked the name "wasabi and ginger".
I thought that is cool name.
So,
I was expecting something OK sushi by the name.
I was wrong.
Totally wrong.
This place is real speudo.
Nigiri was bad.
But,
They have no shame.
It is all right because no one ordering real sushi in here.
This is fxxxed up.
Really fxxxed up.
So, please, take my word.
If you see the sushi counter isn't super clean.
Don't stay, get out,
author: Nobu K.

description:
I've been going to this Sushi place for almost 6 years, I used to live next door, and I highly recommend it! The sushi is great - not the best you've ever had, but definitely good quality, at the right prices. The service is amazing - I became good friends with many of the servers over the years and it's the type of sushi bar experience you want. 

The private room in the front is great for parties. But of course, once you include all that beer and sake, the price gets a bit high.
author: Casey V.

description: Came on a Friday night and it was so fishy smelling I couldn't even stand it- got up and left after 2 minutes.
author: Anna P.

description:
Pseudo sushi you ask???? YUP! 

Sorry Nobu! The pseudo stuff does it for me. Oh ya!

Rolls with names like these get me all sweaty! (from the wasabi yo, sheesh!):

Red Headed Slutty Tuna Roll

Scooby's Sloppy Seconds Roll

The Hidden Eel Roll

Shimmy Shimmy Frisco Salmon Roll

Close Your Legs it Smells Like Tuna Roll

Ok, ok, I'm getting a little dirty here , but seriously I like the fancy shmancy rolls that would be mocked endlessly if they ever attempted to show their faces in Japan.

Shimmy Shimmy Frisco Salmon Roll: "Oooooh, I'm so excited for my first visit to Japan! My homeland! They're going to welcome me with with open arms of seaweed!

(SSFSR nervously boards plane for Japan, sits in business class drinking Perrier, dreaming about playing beer pong with his Japanese cousins while chewing his nails).

Snooty, Plain Old Hamachi Nigiri (with dimples...whatever those are....but he has them): hmmmph! Stupid Americans rolls! Think your sooooo cool with your fancy Ponza sauce and your avocado and unagi wrap! As if! I turn my dimple at you!

SSFSR: (Crying like on of those spoiled little b*tches from My Super Sweet Sixteen) Wha Wha What did I do wrong cousin? 

SPOHN: I SAID KISS MY DIMPLE!!!

(The names of the sushi in this review are FICTIONAL, I repeat, FICTIONAL)

Roomie and I ordered the Yummy Roll which was wrapped in avocado, sprinkled with tobiko and stuffed with spicy salmon; the Spicy Hamachi Roll, which was fresh and magical, and the Tempura Shrimp Roll, which was crunchy and delicious. We also ordered the Hamachi and Avocado special with jalapeno, fried ginger and ponzu sauce. And for desert, butterfish and albacore nigiri. 

Ya, Roomie and I like to eat. So what! You got a problem with that?

The fish was all fresh and excellent, although the butterfish was a bit stringy, or chewy, I can't decide. Our server was a doll, and the atmosphere was very laid back. I'll return fo sho for another round of pseudo sushi! 

P.S. The next time SSFSR attempted a trip to his homeland, he wore a backpack with a Canadian flag sewn on it.
author: Sammy S.

description:
W & G is a great place if you want sushi that is fresh, tasty and original . . . It's appropriately named cuz if you like to pile on the wasabi and munch on ginger like Kettle Chips . . . They are more than happy to pile it on.

And if you have a thing for KILL BILL . . . imagine 3 young sushi chefs with hairdos out of Blade Runner cutting your fish with gargantuan knives to the tune of Euro Trash Techo.  Now that's hott!

My date and I pigged out on all sorts of eye candy including one 'pumpkin roll' and one other tasty thing served in a martini glass on a bed of shredded daikon. Only disappointment was that it was not spiked.  #Dammit#
author: NISHisHOT g.

description:
Who does not like fresh fish, COMPLEMENTARY valet, or even free delivery? 

This place was not crowded when we came for dinner, which was great! We tried the..
Chef Special Roll which had BUTTERfish in it with avocado and topped with hamachi and tuna. When they say BUTTERfish, they ain't lying! 
Rainbow Roll- Typical Rainbow Roll
X Roll- hamachi, unagi, avocado, and it's then topped with tuna, salmon, and this spicy cream sauce. 
Dinosaur Roll- soft shell crab, avocado, and topped with unagi and unagi sauce.
Shrimp tempura-This was my(our) least favorite. It seemed as if they fried it in REALLY old, reused oil!! Ewwwy!!

The rolls were on the teeny tiny side so I was still hungry after eating all those rolls! Reasonable priced and since there were just a couple tables, service was great and fast.
author: Juliane N.

description:
I'm with Amme H. on all counts. It is definitely not a destination sushi joint, though it was introduced to me as such by some friends who live across town. 

The bright lighting just makes the plastic plants look a little too shiny and the TV is downright depressing.  The sushi was delicious, though not presented in any special way (I always give an extra star to a sushi restaurant that does fanciful fish arrangements). The service was attentive. 

If I had a friend in the neighborhood and was craving sushi, I'd go to Wasabi & Ginger, otherwise, not so much.
author: Gretchen T.

description:
This place has some great sushi!  My favorite is the crazy roll--it's absolutely my favorite roll ever.  This place also gives free edamame as an appetizer, free tea, free ice cream for dessert, and free valet parking.  And it's very well priced.  Not the hippest decor, but this place's sushi rocks.  Good place for a casual date.

Update: 12/20/2006

This is my absolute favorite sushi place.  Every sushi place I go, I compare it to here and still nothing compares.  Good job Wasabi & Ginger.  I wish I could have you every day!
author: Vanessa Z.

description:
Ahhhh the suspense of a first date. It can really drive you nuts! But it also gives you the opportunity to run a few tests on the unsuspecting gentleman. I know what you're all thinking, that I'm a game player. Maybe that's true, but I have some major things that I look for in a significant other and I can usually spot them right off the bat.

I had a gentleman ask me out to dinner while riding the cable car home from the gym the other day. Thinking "Wow, those squats are really paying off!" I said yes. He then negotiated that we meet anytime after 6pm...I suggested 7pm to give myself plenty of time to primp after my oh-so-busy day being unemployed. 

The day came, I got dressed and made up and poured myself a glass of wine (never go into a first date stone cold sober! Rule #1) while I waited for my date to arrive. Around ten minutes to 7pm, he called me and said he would be about 30 minutes late (minus 3 points!!--I follow the mantra if you're 10 minutes early, you're on time. If you're on time, you're 10 minutes late! But I digress). I politely let him know there was no hurry...and poured myself another glass of wine. 

Finally he arrived and I hopped into his car. He began to drive like he had a place in mind to eat, but after about 4 blocks, he turned to ask me "What do you feel like eating?" Now I'm all for trying to please the other person, but when it really comes down to it, I want a take-charge guy with a plan! Rather than roll my eyes in frustration, I came with ideas in mind since I've been through this before. 

"Do you have a hankering for anything in particular?" I asked, playing the demure female roll.

"Not really, how about you?" he replied. Ughhhh! I can't stand that type of response. However, now he had left the ball in my court and we were going to go where ever I wanted.

"You like sushi?" I asked, not really waiting for the answer. 

"Sure, what's a good spot?"

"Make a right, two blocks down and park." I told him. Thank God I came prepared. 

I've been to Wasabi and Ginger before but it had been quite some time. I knew it was pretty casual and that they usually played fun music inside. We scored a table (after I was once again put in the position of "What do you prefer?" by the gentleman) and proceeded to check out the menu. I, of course, ended up doing the ordering.

We shared a Sapporo, the Dragon Roll, a chef's specialty involving Ahi with ponzu and caviar, and edamame. The Dragon Roll was perfection, the Ahi was ok...the beer was helpful. I wish I was hungry enough to order some sashimi because the plates going by us looked very fresh and delicious. 

Overall, the atmosphere is light and fun, the food is good and consistent, the staff is friendly and attentive...and gentlemen, hear this. If you're going to be man enough to ask a lady out on a date, do a little preparation. It goes a long way and the ladies love it. The gentleman in this story didn't totally screw up...he's actually very nice and I had a fun time. I'm just high maintenance when it comes to making dining plans. Guess that's why I Yelp with the rest of you huh?
author: Lynsey C.

description:
I ordered California Roll and the waitress asked if I wanted real or imitation crab.

Are you shitting me?  Who WANTS imitation crab?  Who wants imitation anything for that matter?

Still they were very attentive and quick to serve.
author: Jay H.

description: I eat here all the time and they're great. The rolls are awesome, the nigiri is always great, and the service is off the charts. I can't recommend this place highly enough.
author: Reed N.

description:
Maybe it's not particularly authentic, but W&G has some yummy, fresh sashimi at a reasonable price.

But DON'T VALET YOUR CAR! 

My backpack was stolen out of my friend's valeted car and the management at Wasabi & Ginger didn't seem to give much of  a damn.
author: Kathrina M.

description:
I used to enjoy going here for dinner with friends. Times have certainly changed. Never even think about ordering delivery from Wasabi Ginger. Not only has the delivery taken over an hour, good luck if they even get the order right. Sushi isn't a meal you want to have sitting in the back of some 16 year old's car cruising the city for an hour before it arrives. This service is absolutely unacceptable. 

The woman on the phone tried to make ammends but the comedy of errors was beyond belief.A 15% discount on my next order? It took 2 hours to get the order right and delivered. I will NEVER order from Wasabi Ginger again. $5 off? Do you disrespect all your customers like this?
author: Tim F.

description: Not pretentious or trendy, this little sushi house is typical, but good. They offer very fresh top-grade sushi. The service is great and often, they will give you some freebies from the scraps they have sitting around; my compadre and I enjoyed a little diced maguro salad in a light sesame soy dressing with scallions on the house.  The setting is pleasantly casual, yet tastefully appointed and modern.   Great place.
author: Rick H.

description:
Two reviews for Wasabi & Ginger: one for delivery and one for dine in.

Delivery:  I would give ZERO stars for delivery (if I could).  Our food took over an hour to arrive and by the time it got to us the warm miso soup had spilled into the bag and basically cooked our fish!  Disgusting.  We called to complain and the manager was not sympathetic and basically told us "too bad."

Dine in:  The reason I gave them 3 stars.  I would give the dine-in review alone 4 stars.  We go to Wasabi & Gineger when we want cheap, fast, good sushi.  I wouldn't call this a weekend restaurant, but it's the perfect place to sit down for an hour after work and drink a Sapporo with some tasty fish.  Huge bonus: free valet parking for customers!  It's also well-priced.
author: Alyssa W.

description:
Where does one go when one craves good sushi? 

Located on Van Ness, this is by far one of the cities best and most creative sushi restaurants. Unlike many of my other personal favorite San Francisco sushi joints, Wasabi & Ginger remains consistent in both quality and presentation. Some places fluctuate on these qualities, the first visit leaves a great and lasting impression - however the second or third time and the only thing lasting is the fish smell attached to your Louis Vuitton purse. At Wasabi & Ginger, this is not the case.

The fish at W&G is always fresh, always absolutely delicious and there are no hit-n-miss nights to avoid. Here you leave feeling full and satisfied, which can be a rare thing in the world of sushi bars. OK the restaurant decor isn't anything particularly special, but the wall of windows along one side adds an open and airy feel to the place. Also, I prefer not to be seated close enough to see the nose hairs of the person on the table next to me. (In my book, seats this close = tables crammed into every single available space/greed). The seating arrangement here is spaced out, so you don't even have to take turns to breath! How novel!

Wasabi & Ginger is a guarantee! Jack likes!
author: Jack G.

description: Meh. Okay sushi, slow service, reasonable prices. The upside is that means that there are tables available for larger groups on a Friday night!
author: Cindy Y.

description: It's called "Wasabi and Ginger" and serves powdered wasabi and canned ginger...hmmm. The vibe of the place was solid -- very young and definitely sake bomb friendly. My biggest complaint is that the sushi looked terrible. Two of the rolls weren't fully cut and completely fell apart as we ate. The pieces were tiny and the taste was nothing to write home about. I can't speak on the nigiri sushi, as I just had rolls, but I wouldn't waste your money on this place when there are 484030 other sushi places in SF.
author: Alex B.

description:
This place is pretty fantastic.  They've recently renovated or re-decorated or something.... I never made it here before but it looks pretty great now.  The sushi chefs are super friendly and knowledgeable, and the fish is some of the freshest I've tasted.  They're got the standards but remain innovative in their selection of local fresh specials.  

I highly, highly suggest checking this place out.  It's a gem!

Oh and ps..... free valet parking.  Yeah... you just think about that one for a minute.

Awesome.
author: Whitney H.

description:
For a couple of years Wasabi and Ginger was the default "Its-someone's-birthday-where-should-we-go-spot." 

It's decent sushi, not too expensive, but given the parking situation around Van Ness I just don't think it's worth the effort.
author: Jason R.

description: Major fan. Decent pricing for SF sushi. Super fresh, and a good variety.  Free valet parking doesn't hurt either!
author: Bridget B.

description:
(Maybe it's weird that i've only written like 8 reviews and 2 of them are for wasabi and ginger.  But like I said, I come here a lot!)

I just had to update since i went to wasabi and ginger last week and the place is looking swaaank-y!  New leathery looking dark brown chairs and dark brown tables.  Food was delish as always (seriously, order that money train) and the waitstaff was decent-ish as always.  

But please W&G don't raise your prices to cover your new fancy digs.  I love you just the way you are :)
author: Lisa R.

description:
It was a simple meal. We were looking to try out some sushi from the Cozmo Deck but most are closed on Sundays. 
We ordered the tuna poki, seabass with saikyo-miso sauce and served with marinated seaweed, boston roll and Wasabi and Ginger Martini rolls. Meal was reasonably priced but sushi were just eh...altho the seabass was tasty but the miso sauce was a lil too thick and salty.

FYI They offer complimentary valet.
author: Yan M.

description:
I do not like sushi...my husband does.  He loves it with a passion, and we used to live right across the street, so we were here on a very regular basis.  I discovered so many things here that were vegetarian.  They have awesome food.  I did not have a single thing there that I did not like.  They also offer soy paper which I like because I'm not a seaweed fan either.  My husband who loves sushi more than life itself, loved this place.  He raved about the food here non stop.  So if he loves the sushi, it must be good!  

I myself will vouch for anything vegetarian there.  They have quite the variety.  Yum...makes me wish I still lived in San Francisco, just so I could go here again!
author: Ruth B.

description:
I came here randomly the other night and it was quite good, especially for someone like me who loves sushi rolls with crazy combinations and completely un-traditional ingredients. 

We ordered a real crab cali roll, the Fire Work roll (this was good stuff!) and the Wasabi & Ginger Martini roll, which, while very impressively presented in an actual martini glass, was not actually all that tasty, in my opinion...too much cooked fish, perhaps. 

They give you complimentary edamame, which is definitely cool. We got some hot sake, and my bf got the clam soup, which he thought was alright but not fabulous. As we were leaving, the couple next to us was getting served a really great-looking roll, so I asked the server about it and she said it was the Yummy roll...so I'll definitely be trying that next time!
author: Shannon R.

description: We just happened upon this place last weekend after the Union Street fair in Cow Hollow, and decided to try it out.  It was good.  We ordered some rolls and hand rolls.  Everything was clean and tasty, but the presentation was just so-so.  Their rolls were also not very imaginative.  We made a couple of special requests and they did a good job of accomodating.  We would go back again, but there's better.
author: Shaun H.

description:
Despite the aforementioned 80 out of 100 from the Health Inspector, I give W&G two dirty thumbs up!!!  I would first sample the bbq'd veggie plate [hold the eggplant]and the dive right into the Hawaiian Roll [a little on the spicy side] and then finish with a Giant Roll.  Their Spider Rolls are also very good.  Reasonably priced, I am very happy I can walk 20 paces from my front door to this establishment.

They also encourage Saki bombing, if you are so inclined.
author: Taylor S.

description:
A little hard to spot just driving down the street but a nice discovery when you do finally notice it.

The rolls are fresh and I could not find any roll that I did not want to try. My favorites include the 49er, Golden Gate, Firework, and Crazy rolls. 

And the topper, the servers and sushi chefs are willing to take a nice sake shot with you - the sign of a true sushi house.
author: Arin N.

description:
This is my go-to for sushi delivery -- it's prompt enough, it's fresh enough, and it has a wide variety of rolls that keeps me intrigued, interested, and fulfilled as I chow my way through another Thursday night on the couch with "The Big Lebowski" on repeat.

The only mistake I ever made was to actually go inside the restaurant and eat THERE.  The place smelled a little funky, and my order didn't seem as magical as it does when it arrives at my door with a smile.
author: Ann M.

description:
This place looks deceiving because it's on the corner of van ness; hidden, not really anything near it, but it was soo great!!

We ordered the Super dynamite roll, nigiri and chicken udon soup. THey have lots of fancy rolls  that were tempting to get but we wanted soup we stuck to one roll. The super dynamite roll was a spicy, spicy lightly fried roll then drizzled with sriracha sauce. Their nigiri tasted SO fresh and was absolutely tasty.. Their udon soup tasted just average, but I've never been to a place that has had an udon with outstanding taste..they all taste the same to me. But it was still good! I think it could use more veggies though. 

Service was great, very fast and efficient. 

Yay yay
author: Joy A.

description:
There are fun party sushi places, and there are serious date sushi places. This is the former. 

Wasabi & Ginger has a local feel while being easily accessible by means of Van Ness. It's great for large groups and parties, and has semi-private rooms for occasions if need be. 

The sushi is tasty and well priced. The beer and saki is plentiful. The service is fun and very understanding of a boisterous crowd. Highly recommended.
author: Peter C.

description:
I admit it - I'm from the Midwest. Our knowledge of sushi, growing up, consisted of the drab, tasteless faux California Rolls from the local grocery store. Who cares if it tasted like crap, we were MAVERICKS! We were BRAVE! We were EATING RAW FISH!

We were eating like shit.

Fast forward many, many years and my friends that visit me often still think of sushi as those three days-old fake crab mismash that we were 'brave' enough to eat. I then promptly take them to Wasabi & Ginger, and their views change, stat.

I'm not saying that this is the best sushi in the city; it's probably not even in my top 5. But it is GOOD, it is CONSISTENT, and it is FRESH. Their rolls are affordable, and they often have Butterfish on the menu (both in rolls and nigiri), something you don't always find. My personal favorite is the Tiger Roll; I may lie and tell my friends that the unagi on the inside is fried shrimp but it's only so they can taste its fresh crab salad delectableness without realizing that yes, they are also eating eel. Feeling guilty? NEVER.

On certain occasions, they've offered me free ice cream as dessert; other times, they don't. But you always get free edamame (which seems like a small detail until you realize that many of these new, 'fancy' places are charging upwards of $5 for your run-of-the-mill boiled soybeans) and kind, prompt service. 

Never overly-inventive, never overly-pricey, I always walk out of Wasabi & Ginger satiated, satisfied, and waiting for my next out-of-town visitor to arrive.
author: Aubrey S.

description: Awesome! The grilled eggplant is wonderful! Bacon wrapped shrimp to die for. My husband groaned and closed his eyes while eating. He loved the Saba and sushi. Free valet parking. We tipped $3. Nice attentive staff. Got more crowded the later it got on Thurs.
author: Virgil W.

description: Delicious sushi! Make sure to try the super dynamite and grilled asparagus- my favorites!!
author: Heidi H.

description:
Hands down the most excellent sushi place in SF! I say this for several reasons:
1) They deliver.
2) If dining in (why would you??), the atmosphere is not stuffy at all.
3) Decent prices.
4) They have the freshest fist there is (try the pumpkins- my personal favorite)!!!
author: Sarah M C.

description:
Not bad.  A friend and I met there for a late night snack and sat at the bar.  The chef was friendly.  I asked him to select some fresh fish for me, sushi and sashimi, and put it on the plate.  He selected some very fresh fish.  The butterfish, one of my faves was smooth, delicate, scrumptious.  Some standards like salmon and maguro were solid.  Mackeral, suprisingly not fishy.  White tuna had a special sauce, and another fish had a lovely garnish.  Everything was well cut and the rice temperature was perfect.

I normally don't like the fancy rolls and saucy treats, but the tuna martini was really good!

I will certainly return for another treat!
author: apple r.

description: I'd like to give a 3.5 star rating, but I will have to round down. The overall experience- food, service, and ambiance- was very good. We ordered a crazy roll and a spicy tuna roll and those were both average quality and comparable price. I also ordered an order of mackerel sushi. Though they brought out tuna to begin, they quickly and without question changed the order and told us to keep the tuna and try it to see how good it also is.  The mackerel was phenomenal- they had fresh mackerel which you don't see often and it was SO fresh and delicious. I would come back just for that. The service was great, too.
author: Lisa C.

description: Solid nieghborhood sushi spot. Good quality sushi at a reasonable price. Dine-in is pretty mellow and service is good. We do take out or delivery a lot and love it. Some of their best rolls are: Scallop Lover and Wasabi Ginger Martini.
author: Jeannine R.

description: Delicious sushi and lots of great rolls! I love sushi rolls. We did the Omikase and enjoyed rolls and sashimi. Very fresh. Service was good and priced appropriately. Thumbs up!
author: Kristen C.

description: Some of the best freshest sushi in the Bay Area. Their rolls are awesome and I always try the Scallops Lover Roll. The service is prompt and friendly and even if they're crowded on the weekends, you won't have to wait too long.
author: ed A.

description:
Love this place. GREAT for group dinners if you can get one of the private rooms with the tatami mats. Rolls are some of the best I've had and service is attentive and completely understanding. 

I had booked the private room with a head count that kept changing but they let me book it anyway, even if I didn't fill up the table. People showed up at random times throughout dinner but the waitress just kept coming back to take their order and didn't seem at all annoyed that we were ordering piecemeal -- a roll here, an app there, oh and can we get more beer and sake? Totally cool with it.

We were all stuffed by the end of the meal and had our share of beer and sake. Bill only came out to $40 each and we weren't even trying to be frugal. Can't beat that.
author: Veronica S.

description: We had delicious sushi here for a few months without incident.   Over the last two visits we received sushi with brown, partially rotten avocado the first time.  The next time there was a bone in the Firework/FireCracker roll that actually cut the top of my mouth making it bleed it was so sharp.   They handled apologetically and offered us a free meal both times.   We appreciated the response but we will not be eating there again.   It's too bad because it is so close to home.
author: Valerie L.

description: I order delivery from here all the time and it's always delicious, fresh and just what I ordered.  I definitely recommend the place to people in the neighborhood.  I've eaten at the restaurant once and that was an overall good experience too.
author: K G.

description:
This is my favorite spot to put down some sake bombs and some fish.  The sushi isn't the best I ever had, but it is reasonably priced and the staff are very open to putting you on your ass with a plethora of sake bombs.  Wow...last time I left this place I was cross-eyed.  

Once again if you want a place to have a great time (sake bombs) with some good quality sushi I wouldn't look much further than this place.  Walu sashimi ...try it you'll like it....
author: Greg P.

description:
Excellent vegetarian roll selection. I went there twice while I was living in the area this summer.

My fish eating friend really enjoyed his rolls there too.

They loose one star since the last time I went there I go take out and they completely botched the order. They were nice and credited me for a roll I didn't order and did give me a percentage off of my bill at the end. I was still disappointed that I didn't get what I ordered. Just triple check your order if you call in  for take out.

I will miss this place.
author: Jamie M.

description:
Wasabi Ginger is THE place to go when you have a large group of people and want to get absolutely shit faced with pretty fresh and very well priced sushi. I have recommended hoards of people there for dinner parties and have always gotten many thanks. 

That said, make a reservation for the "private" room. There are two large tables there and you can fit around 20. 

Also, the wait-staff is wonderful! Given the boisterousness of our group the past several times we've been to W&G, they have been extremely accomodating. Plus, they WILL sake bomb with you if you ask nice enough :) You won't be dissapointed with W&G,  I promise!!
author: Annie T.

description:
I debated for a long time about my rating.  It was the night after Christmas, so the fact that it was empty made sense.

On the plus side, they bring you a bowl of edamame as soon as you sit down (I love simple things like that!).  They take your drink order very soon after.  They have Nigori sake (cloudy, unfiltered, delicious) AND Sapporo, Kirin, and Asahi.  They give you time to look at the menu with your drink and snack.  Very civilized.  I LIKE it!

But, I do prefer to eat my sushi (or almost anything for that matter) under dim lighting.  EVERYTHING looks better with the proper lighting.  The sushi was just fine.  I was too destracted by the fact that I could actually see everything to notice really.  

Oh, and I do not love the televisions.  Supper and TV do NOT mix in my book, unless you are eating solo!  Boo!  But I guess it's the neighborhood for sports fans.
author: Amme P.

description:
Technically this place is still in my neighborhood, so I like to call it my neighborhood sushi joint, but it is a bit of a hike up the hill to get there.  Yes, they do have free valet parking, but the guy that parks the cars seems a little sketchy to me.  I haven't heard any stories of anything happening to people's cars, just doesn't make me want to drive there.  

In any case, their sushi is fresh and relatively inexpensive.  It's a great place to go when you want quality sushi without the scene most marina sushi restaurants have.
author: Lindsay B.

description: Okay neighborhood place for sushi, reasonable prices and comfortable, $21 for dragon roll, salad and seaweed salad and tip.  Sit at the sushi bar.
author: Mark W.

description:
Surprisingly solid.  Wasabi and Ginger won't blow you away but it won't disappoint either.  Perfect for getting a quick, inexpensive sushi fix.  

If you ever hesitate on having sushi because you don't way to spend the money on it, make a compromise and eat here.
author: Jenny S.

description: meh. i've experienced better. go to elephant sushi on hyde or zushi puzzle on lombard. good for large groups though.
author: Lisa K.

description:
I don't understand the bad reviews.  I have been here several times for sashimi, and the fish is fresh, the pieces are very generous, and the service has been very good!  Valet parking is a real perk, too, in that part of town.
- carmilla
author: Carmilla B.

description:
I USED to like Wasabi and Ginger....

until i got food poisoning and couldn't get out of bed for two days.
author: Lisa L.

description: Sushi isn't something you would necessarily seek out for delivery.  Well, you should.  What I loved about this is that I could order online.  It was so easy to create a login, enter my cc info, then just wait for delivery.  I think it only took 20 min on an estimated time of 45 min.  I ordered the philly, catepillar, and shrimp tempura. . . all really good.  I'm definitely a fan =)
author: Amie W.

description:
Mediocre sushi at affordable prices.  Usually the service is decent but the last visit was completely botched up.  They forgot to put in our order so we waited over an hour for our sushi.  We waited so long the waitress came to ask if we were finished and wanted our check...and we hadn't even gotten our food yet!  The food was terrible when it arrived, we didn't even eat it and they knew they had screwed up but the only thing they did was take 10% discount off the check (about $4).  

Prior to that experience I was okay with W&G for delivery or a quick inexpensive sushi dinner.  Now W&G has been scratched off my list.
author: Vanessa N.

description:
This is my new favorite sushi delivery.  I absolutely love the CRAZY ROLL!  It's so yummy!  I ordered the Maguro Tuna as well and it was HUGE and FRESH!  I had sushi delivered 2 days in a row!!!  

Only thing I ask - give me more Wasabi, please!
author: Noneya B.

description:
Eh...

Came here on Friday night, place was packed. Mostly with people that appeared to be regulars. Now, I understand favoring regulars, its a great way to maintain customer relationships and keep them coming back. However, how do you expect to gain NEW regulars when you treat first time patrons like they don't belong? We went hoping to make this our new spot, but they won't be seeing us again. Ever.

The hostess seated a couple groups of regulars who came in after us while we waited patiently. We got a spot at the sushi bar where we were able to order from the sushi "master" who didn't keep his station all that clean but put out decent (at best) roles and nigiri.

We never mind waiting for a table or for a check because we are an extremely relaxed couple who enjoy long meals together, but when you have 12 dirty dishes in front of you and can't seem to even get the waiters attention to order another Sapporo, you are left with a bad taste in your mouth.

The sushi was not memorable.

Looks like Tataki is destined to become the place where everybody knows our name.
author: Abby Z.

description:
I'd like to give it 5 but I can't because the food just isn't #1. Its solid - but not #1. 

BUT - I LOVE this place. The prices are good and the food is delicious.

The first time I came here was with a group of friends for a birthday party. We ordered about 15 long necks and about 2 bottles of sake for everyone and lets just say - we had a good time =)

We've come back a few times and they remember us (not sure if that's a good thing...).

The sushi roll selection is quite extensive - our favourites being the X-roll, Fireworks roll, and Romeo and Juliet roll.

They also have Takoyaki!!! Something that I haven't found too often in the Japanese restaurants in the city. 

Now if only they also had okonomiyaki....
author: CK Y.

description:
let me preface this by saying that i'm a vegetarian.  so, they really only had 1 or 2 interesting veggie rolls, so my choice was limited.  they had simpler veggie rolls too, but those can get kind of boring.  the veggie tempura roll was pretty tasty, and they gave us free edamame.  i liked the decor and the ambiance, and they were playing 80s music, which was a nice bonus.

one thing kind of annoyed me though.  they close at 10pm, and we got there around 9:10 or 9:15.  they told us last call was in 15 minutes.  i understand that people want to get off work, but there were a full 45 minutes till closing.  it made us feel rushed, and so we ate quickly, and ended up leaving before the other people who had arrived prior to us.  they also turned a few people away at the door around 9:30!  i just thought that was kind of lame, but maybe this is a more common practice than i realize.  i've been taken into restaurants with only 10-15 minutes till closing, quite graciously, and i've always appreciated that.
author: Kate W.

description:
With a dearth of reasonably priced (and good) restaurants in my neighbourhood, Wasabi & Ginger stands out as a good option. By no means is it one of the better sushi places in SF, but one shouldn't expect any better out of an Asian restaurant in Cow Hollow =)

The quality of the sushi is solid for the price and location. I usually get the chicken teriyaki though which is a real bargain for $10. You get a bowl of miso, a simple salad with a delicious Japanese style dressing, and a healthy serving of tender chicken and rice. Don't get the udon though, unless bland is your thing.

There is free edamame at the beginning of the meal, and if you ask for it, free green tea ice cream for dessert.

The level of service can let Wasabi and Ginger down though. While the staff is generally friendly, I can't remember how many times it has made mistakes with our order (particularly forgetting things) both when we dine in or order delivery. If it happened once or twice it would be forgivable, but in the 30 odd times I've eaten at W&G it's happened 7 or 8 times.

Still, with the lack of other good affordable and tasty options nearby, W&G is still one of my go to eateries.
author: Jeremy H.

description: We live right around the corner, so this has been our go to place for sushi. The sushi is really only okay, but it's always been fast. Until recently. There website says to wait 20 mins for pickup and I've waited an hour + the last two times. I think it's time to find a new sushi spot.
author: Ryan J.

description:
Dined here last weekend after craving some sushi rolls. No, not fresh sashimi- just sushi rolls. Plain old Americanized sushi rolls (read: pseudo-Japanese cuisine). The boy and I ate here an hour or so before closing- so it wasn't very crowded by then. Yes, I agree  that the names of the rolls are a bit um.. provocative.. but that's just SF humor for ya- fun and entertaining unless you're in the bottom 10% of the cerebral gene pool. 

They do have something of a valet service going on- if you can even call it that. When we left, the person manning the valet booth had already gone home. Um... our keys?? We had to step back into the restaurant to find someone to get our keys. Needless to say, my opinion of the service here is just a bit under par.

Wasabi & Ginger is a great place to go- the perfect place in fact- if you are seriously craving some sushi rolls. Street parking is a b*tch, but as mentioned earlier, they do offer superior valet service. -_-
author: Elaine T.

description:
Sushi on Sunday is a no, no,....but, this place was surprisingly good for a Sunday early dinner. The "Chef special roll" with Hamachi, Toro, avocado and spicy crab meat was great... 

Fast service, friendly, etc..

I'm really picky with Sushi and was super hesitant going on a Sunday but I'm giving this place 4 stars because for a Sunday the fish tasted quite fresh!!
author: Kristina A.

description:
My friend and I stopped by this restaurant after catching a movie at the AMC Van Ness.  We were not too hungry but not too full, so we thought sushi will fit the bill just right.

On this particular night, the restaurant was half filled and we promptly got our seats.  The server immediately came with our menus, iced water, and a bowl of edamame.  As we munched on our soybean, I noticed their special menu packed with a variety of fish not available at all the Japanese restaurant.  We ended up getting a sashimi plate of ocean trout and some kind of white fish.   

My friend also craved scallops, so we decided to get the Scallop Lover roll.  Personally, I believe God created scallops to be enjoyed by our eyes in the ocean and not in our mouths.  When it came, I was very cautious since my experiences with eating scallops have not been the most pleasant.  Physically, it looked appetizing - a roll with mango and unagi covered with scallops and a white dressing to top it off.  To my amazement, the roll tasted marvelous.  The mixture of sweetness and scallopness (yes, I made up the word) with the warmness of the other ingredients made an explosion of food eutopia in my mouth.  Absolutely, I love this roll and would definitely order it again.

We tried other food items here, though good, did not compare to the Scallop Lover (I cannot believe I just said I love scallops).  The topiko with quail egg, which I have not seen on any menu for quite a long time, also was quite delicious but definitely is reserved for people who can stomach eating raw eggs.  

The staff constantly refilled my water and even had time to tell a joke to us, so no problems there.  A scoop of ice cream finished the night and we were all set to go out merry way.
author: Aaron K.

description: My one time there was great. Great sushi and great service. The fish was fresh, and the tuna belly sushi was awwwwwesome! The tuna just melted in my mouth. Pricing is fair too. The restaurant decor is nice and it's fairly clean. Definitely a place that I would go more often, if I lived in SF. Highly recommended.
author: Armanius M.

description:
The food is about average.  It's not bad, but not great.  Passable.

The reason I won't return is the service.  The wait staff is forgetful.  My girlfriend and I wait forever and ever, and no one offers drinks or a menu or to take our order until they notice someone across the room (read: ME!) is making with the, "What the hell is going on here?!" eyes.

The problem is the staff is incredibly friendly but oblivious.  It's not a matter of being rude and not wanting to take your order.  They just don't seem to know any better and don't realize their customers are starving and need sushi immediately - like they lack the training.  I've been there three times and it's always the same: Friendly when they are visible.
author: Eric M.

description:
I finally had the opportunity to eat here and I must say that it was worth the wait. The sushi nigiri was solid! It was very fresh and looked exactly like a floating fish on a bed of rice. The taste was so delectable,  I absolutely recommend this place to eat.  If you can here, you can't go wrong with the specialty rolls and make sure to give Phoenix roll, Super Dynamite and Tempura roll a try - they really hit the spot for me. I really enjoyed the Super Dynamite because it really was super spicy and it even had a bit of crunch to it with really added a balanced and full flavor to the roll.

The presentation of the food was also fresh and very natural. We were served two huge heaping helpings of ginger and wasabi in an adorable white ceramic bowl to accompany our orders. Now, if that wasn't enough we were also served miso soup in a hulled out wooden bowl  - Yeah, momma likes her miso soup! 

I'll definitely plan to come back here again. The restaurant also had a very interesting fish aquarium by the bar area with a gigantic white fish taking up the water. Another thing I like about this place is if you weren't into eating sushi the menu has a little something for everyone and you can order chicken or beef plates.
author: Laura G.

description:
The delivery was the best part, I ordered on my way in, they arrived just after I came, which was perfect as I had had a long day at work and had a huge appetite.  Jamie Z. and I thoroughly enjoyed our first Wasabi and Ginger experience!

The Unago roll was delicious and probably my favorite, very simple, unagi and mango, but an interesting combination and very delicious. The Tiger roll was my other favorite, unagi sauce and crab and assorted deliciousness abounded throughout.

Definitely recommended as a delivery option, especially on Mondays when many other places are closed.
author: Craig E.

description: The food was very good and the service was excellent. We will be back for sure! I came with my family and they accommodated for us very well. My favorite is the Romeo and Juliet roll so definitely order it!
author: Jessica M.

description:
I am always stuffed and happy when I leave Wasabi and Ginger. This is not a beautiful sushi bar, but a great local gem tucked away on Van Ness. The sushi is delicious with a decent variety. 

I am always surprised with the bill- so inexpensive! A great place to catch up with good friends over good sushi without breaking the bank (not to mention free valet).
author: Jennifer W.

description: Amazing sushi! So glad we stopped in this place randomly on a whim! Fresh fish and excellent service!
author: Jaime N.

description:
Loved it and I'll be back.  It's in my hood (sorry stalkers --- that's the most specific I'll get), so it is quite convenient.  

The caterpillar roll was so pretty that I almost didn't want to eat it, but to rather wait to see if it would turn into an even more yummers butterfly roll.  However, hunger prevailed and I downed it.  It was awesome.  

The menu is expansive --- lots of options here.  The only knock I'd give them here is that a few of the items seem to have so much going on that something gets lost.  We had a roll that must have had 17 different kinds of fish.  It was like the cast of Ocean's 11 (or 12 or 13).  Yeah, I like having Clooney and Pitt, but if you throw in too many stars you eventually stop gaining anything.  

Ambiance was a little odd (fish tank, indoor/outdoor carpet, "Please wait to be seated" sign that I think they took from a Pizza Hut), but Lizzy and I both agreed that it was a nice, casual date. Don't be afraid of the attentive waitstaff.  Yes, they run (literally) around like NASCAR pit crews, but that just adds to the charm too.
author: Dan H.

description: Great sushi, good saki, free valet parking where parking is scarce...can't ask for much more...
author: Mimi T.

description:
I went here tonight and I'm hurting from all the food- it was so good I couldn't stop eating!! The place was busy but not packed and the waiter was very attentive. 

We were seated quickly, told we get free edamame and dessert with our order (free? love it!), and quickly brought our drinks. We got miso soup which was delicious and had about 6 rolls and 1 order of nigiri between the three of us. 

I would have to say that the sushi was quite fresh and to come hungry! The Super Dynamite roll is great, but watch out since it's a little hot!! Nothing there is really expensive, the price ranges from about $4 for two pieces of simple nigiri sushi to $11 for everything.you.could.ever.want.in.a.roll sushi which is pretty good. My friends had raved about their green tea ice cream which they were out of but the mango ice cream brought out instead was fantastic.
author: Erin G.

description:
Definitely my neighborhood sushi joint  :)  Bf and I go here at least once every other week.  Quality of the fish is consistently in the good-to-great range, but not jaw-droppiing, awe-inspiring.  

Menu options are really pretty good - a long list of big rolls, little rolls, sashimi and nigiri, stuff from the robata and noodles...  They also have a pretty good list of specials (some fish from Japan and other places) which I've tried on occassion and been pleasantly surprised by them.  Prices are definitely fair for sushi.  

I return time and time again.  Atmosphere is pretty casual (which I prefer) - but u can dress up trendy if ur going out afterwards and that's fine too.  I love that when u sit down, u get a free bowl of edamame, and when ur done, u get free ice-cream w/ melon balls for dessert.  Yum!  Service is always pretty quick (but maybe it's b/c the waiters recognize me and the bf by now) even when we dont' sit down at the sushi bar.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Great sushi - fun, tasty and inventive rolls.  Also the shiro maguro sashimi was melt-in-the mouth good.  They don't have gomo ae, but some other spinach with sesame dish which was fine, but it took me a while to get my tastebuds and expectations in alignment.  This was a delivery order.  I'd like to dine in one night soon.  Kudos for quicker than quoted delivery.

Thanks to my pal Melanie G. for joining me for din din and the helpful tip.
author: darla s.

description:
A had my first sushi experience here.
In from Chicago, my friend and I went here on Easter last year. This is one of her favorite joints. 
We tried everything.
It was incredible. And I'll never forgot the place that turned me on to what would become my favorite cuisine.
author: Jess S.

description:
I cannot believe I have not reviewed this place! I have probably eaten more sushi here than all other SF sushi joints combined and have not reviewed it!!!
Ok, about 7 years ago I walked into this place after a karate class up the road and it was great! So I kept coming back. Never once have we been disappointed in the food, the sushi is always great. The ambiance (including the usual fixture of a drunken gaggle of screaming chicks in the private front room) could use a little work. 
A couple(?) of years ago they changed owners and some kinks needed to be worked out so we started going to other places (like Kabuto: "the best sushi around") to take a break from W&S.  We came back and had another really satisfying meal.  Big pieces of fresh fish, generous and creative rolls, good (used to be better) service, and not to be forgotten...the invaluable valet parking!

p.s. there is a candy dish by the door filled with various hard candy and for some reason, a little sugar morsel for the car ride home really hits the spot...yes I am a sugar addict but who isn't?
author: Nilu r.

description: Only go on the weekend when the owner is there. They seem to slack when she is not there and the service is not as good during the week. fresh fish and good prices
author: Beth S.

description:
Went there for a birthday dinner -- got my name wrong on the reso, no my name is not Ten-C. 

Great for groups! They have these side private rooms, which unfortunately we didn't have, but we heard people sake bombing and having a grand ol' time in there.

Free edamame to start. That is getting to be the norm, but it's a nice perk. Sushi is good. The fish is very fresh and they give you good-size portions for the price (which is inexpensive compared to most places).

Stay away from the mochi.

UPDATE: They deliver for free if you order $20+. Pretty good deal after a day of holiday shopping and not wanting to leave the apartment.
author: Defne A.

description:
I've been here a few times and can never really "love" it.  It's very good, but not great.  The service is very good, but not great.  That seems to be the theme here.

We had a party in the front room last Saturday night and the place looked filthy.  The floors were wet, the tables were sticky and the service so-so.  the service is definitely better sitting out at a table.  The Volcano roll was good, the tempura was super oily, but the spicy tuna was above average.  

If I was in the  neighborhood, I'd stop by, but this isn't the kind of place you go out of your way to get to for sushi.
author: Zakk D.

description:
Oh Wasabi and Ginger, how I love thee! Ok I realize this isn't Yasuda or Sushi of Gari (only in NY) but for the price and the selection, I am in love. I had the blue shrimp nigiri and fresh saba nigiri last night, and it was divine. Smooth firm texture, sweet, and met my palate with an "AHHHHHH". Soooo good. 

Add'l tip: FREE valet parking and coconut pineapple with green tea ice cream. Can it get any better?
author: Renee K.

description: Came here with a group of 8 for my B-Day. We were seated fairly quickly for a Saturday Night. The service was pretty good. The Sushi was fresh and tasty. Overall it was a good experience.
author: Byron A.

description:
Been here once and most likely would not return. The only reason they get 2 stars from me is because they have free valet parking.
The sushi was mediocre and the staff seemed to take forever just to bring the low sodium soy.
The portions of sushi seemed pretty puny and had a fishy odor.
There are far better places to eat sushi in the city.
author: Kehaulani K.

description: The fish doesn't taste too bad but it has such a fishy smell when you walk in the restaurant. The one plus (which bumped it up from a 2 star to a 3) was the reasonable price of the food. I'm not judging at all on the rolls because I usually only get sashimi. My advice, go with a group - they have a private room in the front. We went for my boyfriend's birthday and they accommodated like 12 of us who were all taking sake bombs and got a little rowdy.
author: Emily K.

description: Excellent food for the money.  We went here on a Monday night and the sushi was fresh and very good - excellent value.  Service was terrific and the prices were very reasonable.  Great place for no-nonsense sushi.  They have some fancy rolls, but we stuck to the basics and were very pleasantly surprised.  I found my go-to neighborhood sushi bar!
author: Alison E.

description: This place is awesome!  Fresh sushi, beautiful presentation.  Friendly waitstaff, Clean and open late.  RECOMMENDED!  Eat here!
author: Hesam E.

description:
This is yet another Chinese owned Japanese restaurant. The food isn't bad.

Spider roll was awesome +10
Nabeyaki Udon was okay +5
Raw fish was okay, but not fresh as I thought it would be according to other reviews -5
Bathroom was typical, but faucet was broken -1
No "irashaimase" -1
Waitress didn't know what shichimi was (flavor for Udon) -1
Boss was around, so service was good +5
Free ice cream! +5

So overall, I'd say, this place is pretty good. It deserves 4 stars.
author: Alton Y.

description:
Wasabi & Ginger DELIVERS!  who knew?  My roomates and I were feeling particularly lazy and decided to order in - and this hit the spot.  It wasn't that fast - took about an hour, but it was totally worth it.  The sushi was as fresh and tasty as it is in the restaurant.

We had all kinds of fun rolls - spider roll, pink dragon, dragon roll, caterpillar roll, etc... and miso soup.  and I liked most of them - there were a couple that were too spicy for my liking but i think i'm just a wuss.

It's also not cheap - but again, with the delivery it was totally worth it!
author: Lauren V.

description:
I used to live upstairs from W&G so I know it well. Everyone needs a local sushi place to pick up takeout every now and then. They have a tatami room for large parties and a back area that can house large groups as well. 2 flat screen tv's for all the sports game so you're pretty much set. They also give you free edamame and ice cream. Stick with the chef's special rolls and you won't be sorry. The tuna tartare is tasty as well. 

If you live in the area, it's a great solid place for sushi but no need to travel from afar to check this place out.
author: Josephine H.

description:
My favorite part about Sundays is........SUSHI Sunday! I usually get it delivered and it's still fresh and delicious!

Favorite rolls are the: Irish Roll, Sakura Roll and the Super Dynamite

Service is sometimes slow (at the restaurant) but they are always friendly!

and they have complimentary valet!
author: jen v.

description:
i came here with my boss, who's from hartford, ct - it was her first time eating sashimi.

the food wasn't bad, the service was ok too. it was pretty safe to take people to that you work with. wasn't too wild, or authentic, or pricy.

i would go back again, but only under the same circumstances.
author: Ameer N.

description:
Shout out to Wasabi and Ginger. They have really gotten good at what they do. i live in the neighborhood so I have eaten here over the years and the last three times I have been here I, and my company, have been totally impressed. I would recommend people go here--its real good! And their music sucks a lot less than it did (still needs some help, but at least it isnt Avril Lavigne on repeat)

Keep up the good work!!
author: Lady L.

description:
Eh.... Nothing to write home about.  Had the crazy roll which was delicious and a cucumber avocado roll.  We were with a party of 20 in the front, sit-on-the floor room.  First of all, it was freezing cold because we were right near the door.  Second, the service was pretty bad - half our group had their food and finished it before the next wave of plates came out.  I realize it's difficult to serve a large group with a small kitchen but I think they could have done better.

I've had much better and more inspired sushi at the same price point at other places in the city.
author: E C.

description:
Great delivery sushi!

I've never been in to eat, so my review is solely based on delivery service.  

I called at 5:15 on Saturday.  They said it would be about an hour.  They were at my place in 45 minutes.  I was happy.

All of the sushi, edamame, and seaweed salad were fresh and very tasty.  I was very happy, and so was my friend.  We both were pleased with our food.  I especially love the spicy hamachi and seaweed salad.

Good price.  I like it so much that I may have to order in about once a week from this place.  I LOVE it!  I'd give it 5 stars, but I've never actually been in the restaurant.  I've walked by many times, but have never set foot inside.  I'd feel odd ranking it 5 stars solely based on delivery.

No complaints at all!

Update:
Now, I have been in to eat.  Three times.  I love it.  Wasabi and Ginger is my great go-to neighborhood sushi place.  Glad it's there.
author: Christina N.

description:
This is my neighborhood go-to sushi place.  I wouldn't say that it's the best sushi in SF, but if you're close, I wouldn't recommend anything else over W&G.  They have a pretty extensive selection of rolls and (perhaps since I'm a frequent customer) will take special requests, like adding extra spicy sauce to the Boston Roll.  They also have rotating specials and of the 4 or 5 times I've tried one, they have always come out tasting great.  The decor is really weird, as if they were trying to recreate being underwater with fishnets hanging above, but whatever.  Oh, and I also find it odd to have a giant fish tank behind the sushi bar so the little nemos can watch their fate played out in front of them over and over.  

Again, probably not the best sushi in town, but the rolls are consistent, service is quick and there has never been a wait.  There are also two curtained-in tables up front for small groups.  Another plus - Halloween-style candy dish on the way out!

Tip: It always seems to be really cold inside, dress warmly!
author: Lindsay W.

description:
Solidly decent food.  Nothing wonderful, nothing bad.  We used to live directly across the street (their neon sign actually reflected off our ceiling at night!) so we ate here a lot!  It's a little pricey.

I love Japanese food and this was always good for a fix.  Better than Sushi Rock on Polk.  If I wanted tons of Sushi we always ventured out to Yum Yum on Irving (I've heard it changed hands, but last time I was there it was still by far the cheapest best sushi in the city!)

Not sure I would make this place a destination, but if you're in the neighborhood it's great!
author: Paige B.

description:
I would recommend coming here for a get together. I love the private
area in the front for larger groups. Our groups usually get out of
control and they are very tolerant of us being loud and at time
obnoxious in here (which is great, it would be awful to get kicked out
a sushi restaurant!) especially when sake bombs are involved.
The food is good and the prices are very reasonable. The décor is not
the greatest, but with all the other pluses, who cares. If you haven't
been you should check it out!
author: Amy B.

description: Their Wasabi & Ginger Martini roll and the Romeo & Juliet roll = drool. Not to mention they have private seating rooms for bigger parties, amazing sake choices and very good service. They have become a staple in our "going out to eat" places in the neighborhood. We have to stop ourselves from overstaying our welcome because we love this place so much.
author: Julie B.

description:
Absolutely a horrible experience.  The place is loud and unruly, and the mangement and wait staff have no control over their restaurant.  A group of overly intoxiated [self-professed] "saki-bombers" got completely out of control the point of harassing another patron.

The mangement and wait staff kept their distance instead of restoring order, allowing the situation to escalate unnecessarily.  They were apologetic and did try to make ammends with all customers that had to put up/witness this episode, but the whole situation could've been avoided and definitely ruined my dining experience.

With that said, the sushi was creative and tasty.  Let's hope this was just a one time situation that is not to be repeated.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Yum, one of my favorite sushi spots in the city and I got to try it for the first time for my birthday dinner, right Ten-C?

The sushi is fresh and delicious. The sashimi is so tasty and so are all of the fun named rolls. I know this may sound lame and not so exciting, but one of my favorite rolls is the basic California (real crab only) and it is great  here. 

W&G can get  busy and you may have a little wait, but most of the time I am seated right away. One word of warning is the mochi, it's pretty runny on the inside.
author: Melanie T.

description:
So, we weren't THAT impressed.

Definitely have to give credit--we showed up with a group of 6 and were seated right away, and this was at 7pm.  That being said...it was a Wednesday...and maybe that's not a good sign?

We got our drink order in right away because we were with the thirsty crew, of course, but then it wasn't a plus that our starters/first rolls took a looooong time to come out.  I mean, how many sake shots can one take on an empty stomach?

Needless to say, by the time the food came out it was a little hazy but...surprisingly yummy.  I would definitely recommend the crazy roll and the dragon roll...delish!  But the tempura veggies were so-so...and the atmosphere is seriously lacking...

Summary is: if you're nearby and you're craving sushi, go get some--pretty cheap and you won't get food poisoning!  But if you're not in the 'hood, not worth the trip.
author: Emma H.

description:
This place was pretty good, for being close to my friend's house, but nothing spectacular. The rolls were all good, but they all seemed to taste the same, the hamachi however was very fresh so extra star for that. 

One good thing about this place is that they have complimentary valet. YES, that means FREE. Who doesn't love free parking in the city, although, if I had my car I would drive to the sushi place on Fillmore next to the theatre, don't know what its called (been there a gazillion times). If I had to walk and was in the area, this place would suffice.
author: melissa g.

description:
The sushi here is really good.  It's affordable, fresh and tasty.  I'm giving it only 3 stars becuse the service f***ing sucks.  

Get the Romeo and Juliet Roll, it's great.  They also do a lot of rolls with Mango which are unique.  Skip the Star appetizers. . .go straight for the sushi/sashimi.

Oh, the edemame is just brought to the table, like bread, and this place is totally affordable. . .another plus!
author: Kristin N.

description:
This is by far the best sushi restaurant in the vicinity. The decor could be better, but their food is to die for... We have had to try and wean ourselves off lately as we were making it a weekly habit.

The california roll knocks all others out of the water, and is relatively cheap for real crab (there's got to be a tiny touch of mayo in there that makes it so juicy!). Once you try W&G california roll it won't taste good anywhere else.

Other favorites include the Super Dynamite roll (absolutely delicious), rainbow roll, shrimp tempura roll, spicy tuna roll, crazy roll, and pretty much anything else on the menu.

Also of note, free edamame and free ice cream. Can't beat that.
author: David R.

description:
I like this place...but it's really not the place to eat by yourself...and 
sometimes they have extremely obnoxious super boisterous sports
bar drunks in here carrying on; aided and abetted by their
airhead girlfriends
author: david f.

description: This place had the most awesomest sushi ever!! Thank you Mila for being born so that we would celebrate your birthday here.
author: Taylor B.

description:
Best if you're looking for a place that does carry-out or delivery - the restaurant itself is hardly anything to write home about.

As with so many other places in San Francisco, the rolls are this places' strong point - Godzilla, Octopus, California, it's all here.  And it's all pretty good.  But that's all it is.  

And don't order any Sashimi.  Seriously.  You DO NOT want to go here.

If you don't want to drop a couple of hundred on a good sushi night, Miyabi and Kamekyo are better bets.  But if you're in the office late and need an out with some deep-fried rolls comprised of what would otherwise be perfectly flavorful and healthy fish, seaweed, veggies and roe, this is as good a bet as any.
author: Forrest C.

description:
oh so oh so good!
They have just the right proportion of rice to sauce to fish. The rolls are creative and never overdone.
The decor isn't too impressive, but service is great. 
I always insist we stop in, if my boyfriend and I are in the neighborhood.
author: Nataly L.

description: Sushi was very average but the price was unbeatable. I went for a birthday dinner and after emptying 2 huge bottles of sake plus a handful of small bottles, we all came out paying no more than $30 a piece. I was excited to try their signature wasabi and ginger martini roll but I found it to be bland. Letting the roll soak in ponzu sauce caused the seaweed to become overly chewy and nasty. If you are a katsu fan, you will certainly get your money's worth here. I think this was the largest plate of deep fried meat I've seen in a while. Wasabi & Ginger fit the bill for a casual, cheap restaurant in walking distance to the Polk St bars but unless I was in a similar situation, I probably wouldn't return.
author: Susan L.

description: This place was good. Servie was nice and come on free parking (it took the guy awhile my only beef with the place..I mean like 20 min and there was no one else waiting but whatever) The serice was great.  Some annoying 20 year olds from out of town but whatever.. The place is good.
author: Pink G.

description: Good and friendly service.  Quick with meals and it's good sushi for a reasonable price.  I even forgot my phone there last time and they returned it to me.  Can't beat honesty!!!  We will keep going back.
author: Dianna H.

description:
This place might just be the quintessence of three stars. 

Let's see:
1. Atmosphere - solid 3. I don't like TVs in my sushi restaurants, but I am sure there are people who do. The bar was not very inviting; the tables were fine. I like the fish tank.
2. Service - yup, solid 3. The guy didn't fall over himself to make it good service; he just took our order, put down our food, and cleared our plates. My sister thought he deserved a gold star for naming the rolls on the plate - NO WAY! They are supposed to do that! She also thought it was above and beyond that he refilled our tea at the end of the meal ... buuuuut, my tea cup was empty long before that, so no again. AND, I thought it was standard for sushi chefs to welcome customers and say good-bye and thanks when they leave. Apparently not because they didn't here - they were involved in their own conversations and watching the Olympics. Eh.
3. The food - yup, 3. The miso is pretty good - I like miso with seaweed and hate it when establishments demur from including it. The fish is fine - it doesn't scream "I am so fresh and amazing." The spider roll is one of the tastiest I have had anywhere, so that's above three. But the SF, rainbow, and Phoenix rolls were a mere three stars. They were all a little off in their own unique way. The tuna atop the Phoenix roll was ... weird ... chemical-like ... I just expected more from a roll so packed with fish. It should have screamed freshness and loveliness with all those fish in there. The SF roll has a nice crunch, but the spicy tuna inside wasn't spicy and was really mushy and seemed like it was missing fish. The rainbow roll wasn't good. We didn't even finish it because the CA roll insides were so mayonnaise-y. Yuck. 

The one four star aspect to this place is the tea. They use the kind that has toasted rice in it - delicious!
author: Jen S.

description: I GOT FOOD POISING HERE! NO GOOD! I was so sick it was awful. I DID NOT have the flu... it was the food and I know it was since that was the only thing I had eaten all day. I also called the restaurant to tell them that I had gotten sick and they may want to look at their shipment. He said it wasn't our food... well he was wrong. It was. I will NEVER eat here again. Too bad too cause some of their rolls are very good - just the repeat is not good! BAD BAD BAD!
author: Jodi B.

description: What a pleasant surprise!  from the outside this place does not look so hot, but their specialty rolls (favorites: romeo and juliet, pink dragon, and super dynamite) are quite tasty.  Lived in the Marina for two years before i ate here- time to make up for lost time!  To make matters even better- you can place an order online if you give about an hours notice and they save your order so you can re-order the same stuff next time!.  Take out night just got a whole lot easier!
author: Kari P.

description: After dining here it became clear that there are a few people who come here all the time, spend  a bunch of money, and are very well liked by the wait staff (rightly so). However, the good treatment of some doesn't have to mean the complete abandonment of other customers. We were bumped from our place in line by the hostess and were waited on whenever the wait staff had a free moment. To top it off the sushi was merely acceptable in taste, and totally boring in presentation. I would put up with such nonsense if the sushi was ridiculously good, but it's pretty boring and not cheap either.
author: Alex D.

description: An hour in the Hot tubs across the street + green tea & fresh sushi at wonderful, homey, not too trendy despite it's Upper Van Ness location Wasabi & Ginger = perfect date.
author: Maria D.

description: I think this restaurant is just OK - not great, but not bad either. I think there are much better sushi places in the city. I was particularly disappointed by the Kobe Beef Sushi. It was cooked.
author: Piotr P.
