description: What died underneath the tatami mats??? Seriously, I dissect cadavers 2 days a week and even I wanted to barf when I sat down. However, the copious amounts of sake, sapporo, and wasabi desensitized my nose and made the evening more tolerable. +1 star for the spicy Firework roll and for accomodating a party of 13 at 8:30 on a Fri. night.
author: Lauren Y.

description:
aesthetically pleasing if your thing is to dine in an establishment that is a combination of a chinese club, aquarium, and fisherman's boat. i know that this place is a quasi-sushi restaurant but when i go to a steakhouse i don't see pictures of bovine creatures or decor that i'd associate with a pasture.

food is actually decent. just eat in to the rhythm of the trance-techno-goobly-gook music which should mean you'll be done in five minutes. if you can get past the 2 plasma tvs that are showing the latest episodes of the 'inside edition' or reruns of 'will and grace' (how about, i don't know, ANIME!?!?!?!?), hear over the occasional "sake bomb",  not get frightened by the asian-OG clientel, and not be confused too much about sushi-makers that have more style to their coiffs than most girls --- then ok, the food / beer is solid.

tyrone biggums would def rummage the garbage bins of this establishment.
author: Marcus W.

description: I love Wasabi and Ginger!  It's one of my favorite sushi places because 1) it's cheap, 2) you get free yummy green tea and edamame, 3) it's good sushi, and 4) the ice cream. My favorite rolls are super dynamite, crazy roll, spicy tuna, and dragon roll.
author: Michelle F.

description: My roomie and I often order sushi to be delivered from W&G. It's always faster than the time they quote and the sushi is consistently fresh'n'tasty. I've had much better sushi, but for delivery it's great!
author: Rose K.

description: This restaurant offers just what you're looking for when you go to a sushi restaurant:  fresh sushi, fun/funky atmosphere, friendly and prompt service, all at an affordable price.  Plus you can always count on them for great music and free edamame and ice cream every time!  Two thumbs up for Wasabi and Ginger!!!!
author: Liz L.

description: Had sushi here for the first time about a week ago and will probably go back at some point this weekend. Creative rolls and not too expensive. House of Sushi was my staple sushi place in San Francisco. Only a block away I was turned on to this gem. I think I found a my new staple.
author: Nancy B.

description: Honestly, this place was damn good.  I can't vouch for service while dining there, but I got take out yesterday after reading some reviews online.  Plus I live like 3 blocks away.  And now I am pissed that it took me 8 months to come try this place!  The X Roll was AWESOME.  And the miso soup was really great, which is important to me.  Definitely check this place out!  I can't wait to get back there.
author: Alex R.

description: This place is solid, and has earned the spot of my automatic default restaurant. First of all, you just can't argue with FREE VALET PARKING.  The food is good ( I love the ahi tuna in a martini glass and the grilled veggies) and the food is cheap. The low cost of things leaves plenty of room to drop your cash on sake bombs!  Plus, there are Brachs Butterscotch discs and other assorted candies at the door which pleases me greatly.
author: Alexandra A.

description: I love their idea of side specialties like sea bass, stuffed mushrooms, asparagus and beef, etc,  but I don't think it is the best SUSHI spot..the portions are small, and the pieces of fish are tiny. Service is friendly, they also have valet parking which is great! 4 stars from me!
author: Anastasiia G.

description: Again, a running theme for my sushi places is a bargain value and good service.  Edamame for free, friendly sushi chefs and quality consistent rolls.  Not too shabby.  Great deal for house sake too.  Visit W&G and you won;t be disappointed.  Delivery is a bit slow.
author: Mark J.

description: My gf and I went here the other day after pondering for a while which sushi joint to hit up.  I was pleasantly surprised as from the looks of the restaurant (and location), I wasn't expecting much.  I thought the sushi was pretty good and reasonably priced.  They had all of the fancy rolls that most people like to order but we stuck with the nigiri.  I thought it was pretty good!  The one special dish we ordered was a lobster tail which wasn't that great.  We should have known to stick with the classic stuff.  Anyway, given I was pleasantly surprised and the bill was very reasonable, we were pretty happy campers!
author: Jessica T.

description:
Let me just jump in here by saying I'm the kind of sushi eater that makes purists shudder. I order rolls, not sashimi. Wave a suction cup or tentacle at me and I run. For me the mark of a good sushi joint is all in its menu of yuppified rolls. The more creative urban fusion, the better. Keep the fried rolls coming, but don't compromise the quality of the fish. We had an excellent chef's special roll with a toro core and a butterfish, tuna, and hamachi topping. It's enough to make me take the dive into sashimi. 

The free edamame, valet parking, and ice cream chaser sweeten the deal and keep the bill low. Is it almost dinner time?
author: Jessica D.

description: The food was average.  The service was polite and attentive but the waiter we had couldn't split the bill and couldn't speak English.
author: Alex G.

description: They have a very extensive menu and their specials are pretty tasty.  They also have free delivery!  Love it!  Their sushi is fresh and they are very attentive.  They have great rolls with very creative names.  The X Roll and Super Dynamite Roll were great.  And the edamame is included! Great miso soup too! It's fairly priced, fast and convenient.  I will definitely be back.
author: Lauren M.

description: not that another excellent review is needed but I must say this is my favorite sushi place. It helps that its only a few blocks away from me but honestly the quality and service are superb. They always have great specials and inventive tasty rolls. Plus free edamame and divine ice cream makes this place a gem you shouldnt miss.
author: Meg L.

description: Fabulous low key sushi restaurant.  Fish is fresh, and the special rolls are always yummy.  I love the fantastic roll. The sauce is comes with is SO good.  I got the hamachi hot plate that is served with garlic, lots of it, and a jalapeno ponzu sauce...tasty!  Did I mention they offer free edamame and ice cream?
author: Lisa D.

description: Pretty damn good sushi. Started out with the Toro (sushi) and Red Snapper (sashimi) specials. Next came the King Crab roll and the Regular Sashimi plate (15 pieces). Also ordered some Hamachi, salmon, unagi, etc etc. The Hamachi was probably the best of everything as it just melted upon contact with my mouth. The prices are reasonable and the service is friendly.
author: Nicolas H.

description: I haven't had Japanese food in months and I always walk by this place.  I order pretty standard things from a Japanese restaurant.   My first time at Wasabi & Ginger I ordered the San Francisco, Boston and Golden Gate rolls.  I also had the cold Soba noodles and a hot Sake.  All together it was $35.  Everything tasted the way it should and I thought the service was great.  I did go just before they closed on a Sunday night so that may explain some things.
author: Corey V.

description: Because San Francisco has such a great little Japan Town, there is really no need to dine at Wasabi and Ginger.  Their agedashi tofu is awful and the overall ambience is pretty mediocre.
author: Zinzi L.

description: This place is one of my FAVORITES....the sushi is decent..the atmosphere is GREAT..and it is relatively inexpensive...the service is wonderful...truly some of the nicest people in SF work there...me likey
author: Jamie W.

description: I actually really liked this place. The sushi is really good and fresh, the teriyaki chicken my friend ordered not so hot. The atmosphere is laid back, it was sort of a kick to hear Hillary Duff while eating sushi, but whatever. Good prices and good food.  The service could definitely be improved upon, the wait staff super nice, but beyond slow.
author: Erica A.

description:
Average at best. Maybe I went on an off-night, but it was ONLY mediocre. One thing I did like was that they provided edamame for us to eat. And we needed it. We waited so long for our appetizer to come - agedashi tofu (yes, we did remind our waitress over & over to see if it was ready). If you can't provide the appetizer before the main dish, don't put it on the appetizer part of the menu. We still hadn't received our tofu EVEN after we had finished 2 rolls and a chirashi. So we just cancelled it. 

The fish wasn't that fresh (you know it's fresh when it just has that melting in your mouth feeling - instead our fish just tasted fishy and just slimy), the rice tasted old... enh there are better places in SF.
author: Jeannette L.

description: We always keep coming back here for awesome and affordable sushi. Since my husband isn't into the whole fish thing he enjoys their veggie wraped in soy paper. Great service and love that they serve you "ice cream in the house" after dinner.
author: Diane M.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! The service was great, parking was great and food was soo good! And the free dessert was a plus! I would recommend to anyone!!
author: Danielle K.

description: O~ and I came across this place by accident. I was trying to get us to a restaurant that I heard about through a friend and ended up here and its not bad for yummy and not-so expensive sushi. Its a no frills type of sushi place and we usually don't have any problems getting seating. Definitely a great spot if you are craving sushi without wanting to make an effort.
author: Bernadette L.

description: Great sushi, chill atmosphere, reasonable prices. I go to this place pretty often and have never had a bad experience. Also, you can sake bomb here. Although I suppose you can go sake bombing at any sushi restaurant that serves sake and Sapporo always feel awkward doing it in certain restaurants (too fancy, too small, too afraid to break the fragile table). Not here... especially if you reserve the private room in the front where you can sit on the floor and sake bomb to your hearts content. Try the Fire Work roll - its amazing.
author: Esther A.

description: This is my new favorite for sushi in the Marina / Cow Hollow area. The ambiance is nothing to write home about, but the sushi is amazing! My two favorite rolls are the Romeo & Juliet and the Pink Dragon. I've done both dine in and take out and I have never been disappointed!
author: Ang H.

description:
This was fabulous sushi! Great fresh fish. Joe was great. We let him suggest items such as fresh aji,fresh saba,fresh tako and the best was the foie gras!!!!! I made rude noises when Iate it!!   Their ocean trout was better than salmon.What a pleasant change to sit at the sushi bar and have nice conversations and smiles!!!

We will definately drive back from Calistoga to the City for this service!!
author: donna j.

description:
good sushi especially their King California Role and Vegetable Dragon Roll.

ordering appetizers from the grill seems to take a long time be it their short ribs or chicken kabobs.   Ribs sometimes consist of a lot of fat which I can do without.

Expect at least an hour for delivery.

Overall, I enjoy going here for my sushi needs.  Of course, it helps that I live about 3 blocks away.
author: i a.

description: A good, fast sushi place to hit when you have a large crowd. You'll always get a seat, and the menu has something for everyone. Do not be decieved by the "dive-ness" of the exterior, the fish here is sure to please both your appetite as well as your wallet.
author: Amanda C.

description: I was showing family around town today and had horrid flashbacks as I drove by W&G.  I know it was like 2 years ago since my first and only experience eating here but the memory of bad sushi just wont leave my mind.  The name Wasabi and Ginger is very fitting as I remember that was the best part of the dinner .
author: Steve D.

description: Still love it. We go at least once a week. (Largely because it's close and we're lazy and the hill to our other sushi spot is a bother.) But I do have one bone to pick. They really need to hit shuffle on the whatever ipod they have plugged in. Depending on our timing in the evening we'll hear in order: Ashlee Simpson, Avril, Beyonce, Christina, etc. I pretty much try to go as late as possible to see what's beyond 'D'. It's like a weird TRL mix that's in alphabetical order.
author: Jackie B.

description: Meeeeahh. Well, it was just ok for me. Heard the cooked stuff is worth trying, but even the beef teriyaki was just so so. Oh well, guess it works for those people this end of Van Ness.
author: miriam b.

description: Few friends and I visited this Japanese restaurant for a birthday dinner.  The service is okay, food is pretty good though.  I liked that one roll, it had crab and some shit inside which I forgot.  It was like edible crack man!  The super dynamite roll was tasty as well.  There was so many items on the menu that I wanted to try.  Parking, like anywhere in the great city of San Francisco is a pain in the ass.  But its also one place thats actually worth eating at.
author: A L.

description:
This place is my favorite take out sushi place.  My roommate and I call Wasabi and Ginger at least once a month.  They are quick and the sushi is really good.  It is a great atmosphere to eat and it is very casual.  They have a private room where you can sake bomb with a large group of friends.  

I love their cucumber salad and miso soup.  Their rolls are good and the wasabi has a kick to it

The best thing is that they have valet parking and they deliver.
author: vikki a.

description:
Living near Polk St, this is the only sushi place I look forward to within walking distance. It has become my neighborhood stop for sure.

I have been a handful of times, and always loved the food, the service and the ambiance. Last time I went I had omakase, and was pleasantly surprised by some of the things things they put in front of me. Scallops 4 ways included the liver, and was amazing. And scallop nigiri with toasted foie on top stole the show.  Pricing is fair.  Food is solid. People are great.
author: Jon G.

description: If I didn't live nearby, this is one of those places I'd never go out of my way to. That said, when we want some quick decent and affordable sushi, and we don't want to go far, W&G is one of our standbys. The complimentary edamame and ice cream is a good touch, as well as the free delivery. Sometimes they even have good cheap oysters on their special board. The interior is nothing to write home about, although I do like the fish tanks.
author: Neil K.

description: decent spot to grab a bite of sushi when you circle sushi bistro for 30 minutes looking for parking (what is UP with that?). had a few rolls here, none were that memorable, but they were certainly tasty and the service was efficient. i don't love the lay out of this place - you are pretty much forced to stare at the bar and the television behind it. kind of cheapens in the atmosphere. i'd come back but it wouldn't be my first choice. also, i was here on a monday night around 8pm and it was super empty. hmmm....
author: Rachael S.

description: Good sushi, great price. This is low-key neighborhood sorta place. The sashimi is really delicious, as are the spicy rolls. Ask what's best that day, and they'll bring you something yummy. Throw in the free edamame and green tea ice cream, and you can't go wrong.
author: Leigh M.

description: I ordered massive amounts of sushi from this place a few months ago when I was hosting a get together at my house.  We ordered online but when we didn't get any confirmation I called.  The girl on the phone was nice enough and said the sushi would take 45 minutes to arrive at the house.  Nearly 3 hours later, when my guests were near starvation I called again and asked what the deal was.  The driver had gotten lost, although they are located less than .5 miles from my house.  Only when I prompted how they could compensate for lost time and hungry guests did they offer a small discount on the massive party trays that I'd ordered.  When the driver came he was also very nice and apologetic and was tipped.  The food, when it finally arrived, was average, nothing at all special.  A few weeks later I received my credit card and had to go BACK into the restaurant since they had charged my card twice.  I waited and waited in the empty restaurant as they floundered around trying to figure out what to do with me, not even offering a free drink or a water or anything to ease the frustration I was feeling.  I probably waited for 30 minutes until I finally just let them take the small slit of my credit card bill as proof of what had happened.  I know mistakes happen when running a business and I feel like I give people a benefit of the doubt more than they might deserve but this was ridiculous.  I should not suffer and WAIST SO MUCH TIME on other peoples mistakes without getting compensated or at least some type of sincere apology for their incredible lack of being able to run a business.  I would not recommend this place.  I can only imagine their inadequacy behind the scenes.
author: Jessie J.

description: I don't know, I just wasn't that impressed. I thought the sushi was fine for what it was, but it wasn't that great. It took forever for my server to bring me a glass of water which kinda bummed me out. Also, I typically don't enjoy Britney Spears/Carrie Underwood as background music while I am trying to munch on my edamame. I'll go back, because its so close and great for those blah Wednesday night "what-should-i-eat-but-i-don't-want-to-cook" moments.
author: Kristen D.

description: Wasabi & Ginger is a great place to come with a group. Reserve ahead of time, and enjoy the Japanese-style table in front. I am always amazed at the quality and price of the sushi here. The rolls are tasty and not too American-style or overdone. It's a bit out-of-the-way, so not to crowded during the week.
author: Sahra H.

description: The sushi is pretty good here, always fresh and tasty. It's not the best I've ever had but it'll suffice. The real winner here is the service, they are always fast and efficient and sometimes they give you free ice cream at the end. What more could you ask for? Make sure you read the specials on the board as they have some really good deals usually. Also make sure you read both specials boards, you'd think they have the same stuff on them but they don't. Sneaky!
author: Cathy T.

description: Really decent sushi and it was delivered on time and still fresh (although I was only 2 blocks away). It was a hit at the party. The unagi with mango was decent, but the tiger roll and rock and roll were exceptional. I also liked the veggie rolls a lot even though I typically do not eat veggie sushi, the shitake mushroom/avocado was well received by the guests. Definitely worth a try, especially because they deliver.
author: Katherine B.

description: I came here specifically because some friends had raved about the vegetarian dragon roll, odd though it may seem.  So we ordered it.  When they brought out the dragon roll, I pointed out we had actually ordered the vegetarian one.  "Oh, I didn't hear you" and that was that.  So much for raving about the sushi.  With the abundance of sushi restaurants in the neighborhood (and really, the city), it's not hard to be picky.  Wasabi & Ginger is just average -- in its food, its service, its atmosphere.
author: Mitzi C.

description: Relatively inexpensive and decent Japanese fare.  There is no inexpensive equivalent in Japantown.  Plus, there is valet parking.  I like the Tempura Udon.  Beware the private room near the front-- it is often filled with drunken Marina frat boys who order California rolls (what else.  California Rolls are authentic, RIGHT??) and are super super LOUD (noise carries, which drunken frat boys don't seem to know).
author: Caroline I.

description: Their sushi is good, and they like it when you come to party.  Come with a big group, order a bunch of sake bombs, and have at it.  Don't forget to tip well and thank everyone profusely for putting up with your poor behavior.  This place isn't pretentious - its just allsome.
author: Andrew C.

description: Best sushi that I get to try in the city.  The lobster roll is really good, the sauce is very nice.
author: Lily K.

description: So close to my place and they deliver, but way too much rice in the rolls and the nigiri. I know fish is expensive and rice is cheap, but that's no reason to overload me. They use good quality fish here and have a decent selection of options, but they aren't going to overwhelm you with anything cutting edge or innovative. I also consider myself a wakami connoisseur and there's is just so so. Can't speak to the ambience or service since I only get delivery!
author: Keith R.

description:
the boy had told me about this place for awhile... but we would always end up going elsewhere with the plethora of dining choices here in the city. 
so two weeks ago... we finally decided to go so i can give it a whirl. 
we walked in and i was pleased at how large, clean and spacious it was.  the front tatami room was very cute and surprising  - for the marina. 
regarding the menu...wow. the choices were endless - inventive and scrumptious!
we ordered many rolls and all were very fresh and delish!  
and they carried my fave sparking sake to boot! 
its within walking distance from boys, so it makes for a nice evening stroll.  
cant wait to go back again!
author: Caroline S.

description: Are there better sushi places? Sure, but not for the money. Free edamame to start you out and a long selection of rolls make this a good place to go, say before, during, or after some drinking...
author: Jan Michael K.

description: I have had better japanese food, the portions are kind of small and the place seems a bit overpriced.
author: Chris S.

description: no frills but has a good variety of rolls at decent prices with fresh fish!  another plus is they have free valet!
author: Helen T.

description: Decent place to get sushi.  I think the rolls here are better than the sashimi, but everything is tasty.  Doesn't ever get too crowded where the wait would be out of control.  Decor and ambiance are lacking.  If you drive, they have valet!
author: Katie P.

description: Like everyone else has mentioned - fresh, good sushi. I especially liked the butterfish and dragon roll. We stuff ourselves silly and the bill was something like $100 for 4 of us...can't complain about that.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Last time I was at Wasabi and Ginger, I broke a tooth.  But that wasn't their fault, so I'm not going to hold it against them.  (I'll take issue with my dentist there.)

While my part of town has a surfeit of sushi bars (Sushi Rock, Nara, Ace, Mas Sake), there is a derth of decent ones, which is why I find myself coming back to Wasabi and Ginger again and again.

They don't list my favorite roll---shiitake---on the menu, but when the chefs snap their fingers three times, a pretty oishii (delicious) one appears at my place.  They offer complimentary ice cream, complete with partially frozen fruit, at the end of the meal; last time, I begged off on the dessert, but when I changed my mind a few minutes later, our waitress was at the ready to bring me my scoop.

Added bonus is that they have a bowl of candy at the exit---just in case you were steadfast in your ice cream refusal, or it didn't satisfy your sweet cravings.
author: Hannah J.

description: Good sushi. Great service. I've had a good time everytime I've visited.
author: Billy Q.

description: YUM.  This place is so good.  I've eaten in several times and have ordered delivery on more occasions than I can count.  I have never had a bad meal here, and I definitely have my staples:  Unagi Nigiri, Irish Roll and the Romeo and Juliet roll.  I've tried almost every roll on the menu and most are excellent.  This place is pretty affordable and the people are very friendly.  Delivery is usually pretty fast and the sushi always arrives fresh.  Give this place a try- it's great!
author: Jessica C.

description: Not so great....I was really looking forward to trying out a new sushi place, especially one that's close to my house.  It is a big place with a big bar so it was easy to get a seat at the bar.  The sashimi we had wasn't very fresh and the rolls were ok but tasted like the premade rolls you can get at trader joes or safeway.  Not worth the money...go some place else.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: When my fiance and I moved in we were SO excited to find this place just down the street.  Our first experience was great, we left with an overall decent impression (good food, pretty poor service).  What I noticed though is over the course of the last few months the quality has consistently gone downhill.  The last few times I've had it I've ended up not feeling well after.  Last night was no exception.  We brought home four rolls, none of the fish tasted fresh, but I figured with $50 in sushi sitting in front of us, it aught to be eaten.  Well both of us ended up with...lets just say fairly "upset" stomachs.  I told my fiance that we aren't going back again.  We'll be looking for a new sushi location next time we get the craving!
author: Chrys W.

description: I just stumbled upon this place, and it was greatttt!!! The service was very friendly, and the food was more than I expected. Top quality, fresh, tasty! Definetly must go back =D
author: Wendy L.

description:
The Scallop Lover roll was nasty.. scallops tasted really rubbery..nothing too special about this place. I did however like their Pink Salmon roll and they gave us free edamame beans....

My boyfriend had the really good chicken katsu..it wasn't overly breaded which he hates....great sauce that came with it to. 

A group of white people I saw order some intersting things. I was wondering what they were. ahh white ppl always make me laugh...
author: Crum B.

description: The sushi is good and the environment is casual with fishes and nets. The kitchen is great and it has a Japanese style room which allow a lot of people where you kneel down to eat. Typical Japanese. Great sushi $5, Hamachi Kama $ 6-7, Wasabi and Ginger priceless.
author: Norman S.

description: I went here last week for my friend's birthday dinner. It was a party of 20, but amazingly they were able to accomodate us all. The food came out pretty quickly too. The rolls were reasonably priced, but not amazingly good--I've tasted better.
author: Carrie W.

description: If you're looking for solid Japanese food, go here. There's nothing fancy about it, but you leave full and with some money still in your pocket (e.g. happy).
author: Justin C.

description: This place kicks ass. I've noticed some not so great reviews of the California roll, but please, who the hell orders the California roll if they're a true sushi connoisseur. My top three things to order at this place are the hamachi hot dish, the Chef's special roll and any roll with the butterfish. The hot dish is a HUGE plate of fresh hamachi with jalapenos, garlic and avocado. You will have garlic breath, so don't order this one if you planning on making out that that night, but its delish. The butterfish can hardly be found anywhere else and its amazing--kind of like ahi tuna only better. The chef's special has this in it, ahi, and avocado--huge fan. Definitely recommend hitting this place up if even for take out since it can get pretty crowded on weekends.
author: Kristin B.

description: i really like japanese food. it may be my favorite, along with spanish food from the motherland. I don't know if i was just insanely hungry, but the food was top notch. the veggie rolls were super super tasty and the grilled vegetables were actually amazing. i come to appreciate good veggie food. seems everything everyone else ordered was totally devoured, so i must have been good. the sake and beer kept flowing too, service was nice, and the room we got was fun too, with the tables a little lower to the ground, and the curtains to enclose the room. good place for groups/special dinners. yummy!
author: Jess P.

description:
eaten at the restaurant a couple times. not really a place you'd go for ambiance, but the service was fine. and the decor was...  well lit?

whatever. who cares about that stuff. what i care about is that W&G makes a very solid assortment of sushi and they deliver. i love the irish roll, and the lucky stars make me happy.
author: Jeff T.

description: The best rolls in SF, bar none.  They have great service and will remember you if you return.  Really great food and people.  Perfect for a neighborhood sushi spot!
author: Shane B.

description: I would've given this place 3 stars after coming here multiple times, but knocked it down to 2 thanks to my last dining experience.  So the food quality is just fine as well as the price.  But my most recent experience had me waiting almost 15 minutes for my meal...after my friend had been served his.  So I am sitting, he is eating (didn't want his udon to get cold) and time after time the waiter just passes me by, once or twice saying it was coming out soon.  Eventually it comes out, I barely get any apology or anything to try to make amends.  Just unacceptable for a dining establishment.
author: Johnson H.

description: This is a down-to-earth neighborhood joint that serves up some decent sushi. It's not the best sushi in town but it's pretty good. The wait staff is friendly but they are a bit slow when busy so bring your patience. The place can get a bit rowdy when they have groups but can also be fun for a date on a quieter night. Overall, I like this place and like to go there. I just think there are better places to go if you really want stellar sushi.
author: Carter F.

description: Solid sushi with solid prices. I used to live above this place so was a much more frequent diner than I am now. But, every time I go, I am pleased with my sushi and the service. The atmosphere is not all that sexy or sceney, but it's still a great spot for groups.
author: Shannon C.

description: Reasonable prices, creative creations, consistent food, is what comes to mind when I think of the positive things about Wasabi and Ginger. However I have eaten there three times now and every time someone at the table received their food exceptionally late. So late in fact that by the time it arrived everyone else had finished their plates. I must say that they were apologetic and gave us complimentary beer. Unfortunately it's happened more than once. So if the positive things previously mentioned sound appealing, be prepared, you could be there a long long time.
author: Cierra C.

description:
This place is great.  I went with a group of 8 people and pretty much ate and drank for 2 hours straight.  At the end of the night we each only ended up paying about $25 a piece.  For the amount of drinking and eating we did, I expected realistically to pay about $45 a person at least.

The service was great and really relaxed.  If you're looking for great atmosphere, and good inexpensive sushi, this is the place.
author: Alan L.

description: This place looks like a hole in the wall but sometimes those are the best places.  I love the vegetarian rolls and my fiance loved the sushi.  The miso was superb.  Would definitely make a special trip out there again.
author: Jaclyn G.

description: Was an easy walk from my apartment, and always a fun place to eat.  With a large group of friends, you can ask for the private room in the front.  Very nice staff, and the food is very good.
author: John T.

description: This is my favorite sushi place in the city! The food is always good and the price is always right.  The service can be slow at times, but it hasn't disappointed me yet!
author: Jennifer L.

description: I've been coming here for years and enjoyed it until a few weeks ago I thought something died in my mouth. The fish was rotten and had a smell to it that made my friend and I sick!
author: A D.

description: I'm by no means a sushi connoisseur, but I think this place is great. The valet parking certainly helps in terms of convenience, and we were able to get a table for 3 on a friday night without a reservation with only a 20 minute wait. The monster rolls are particularly tasty, i highly recommend the super dynamite roll. and the free edamame and ice cream was a great little addition.
author: Manlio L.

description: DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY from this restaurant, especially if you are actually hungry.  It was WELL over an hour before I even called back to check on the delivery, they said he was on his way, fifteen minutes later we still did not have our food, so I called back, they said it would be ten minutes.  When the food FINALLY arrived, it was nothing special at all.  The only thing that was decent was the wakame salad & I don't think you can really mess that up.  I had such an awful customer service experience and such a mediocre food experience with this restaurant that I will NEVER go back.  I wish I read some of these reviews before I decided to order from there!  I feel like one star is being generous.
author: r d.

description: this place is absolutely amazing!! Total hole in the wall awesome!  Fish is great, rolls are amazing, and prices are very reasonable.  If you go, order the Romeo and Juliet roll, it will change your life.
author: Heather B.

description: "Super Dynamite Roll" is all I have to say!! Awesome, fresh sushi, and really friendly staff!!
author: Ellie C.

description: This place is next to my apartment and therefore I eat there more than any other Japanese joint in the city. It works out though, cause the place is actually real good. Stick to the sushi and rolls because the other meals are pretty standard. Noodle bowls can take a LONG time. Good variety of rolls and the stuff tastes pretty darned fresh... Only thing that makes me wonder is the newly posted 80 out of 100 health inspection... I have eaten there countless times and never gotten a tummy tinge, but I do see the guys that work there smoking a fair number of cigarettes near the side door.
author: Eric W.

description:
Food - excellent sushi
Service - good

Good date place
author: Phi N.

description: One of my favorite current Sushi spots! I've been here about 6-7 times already and each time's been really good. The Super Dynamite rolls are really good. Their Aji is SUPERB...had some Tai (Red snapper) sushi last night, some Hamachi sashimi, some Toro...ALL GOOD. Service is excellent, place is fairly large. Only downside is parking sucks big time some nights.
author: Steve K.

description: Great atmosphere - nice staff - very good fish.  Nothing fancy, just a casual solid place for sushi.
author: Erik K.

description: Since my friends live in the area, we frequently visit this restuarant.  The rolls are standard but I love their beef sukiyaki and butterfish. Great service and a fun place to go to for birthday parties!  Plus, there's free valet parking in front!
author: Willa H.

description: what i love about this place asides from the affordable good sushi is the FREE valet parking in the cow hollow area!  how can you beat that!
author: Swarup B.

description: Great consistent sushi for a great price.  This is a well kept secret for sushi.  Or well, it used to be.  Service is great, food is fresh and creative.  They even have a cute private room for group events, though for this room you need to leave your shoes at the door.  All meals include free edamame and ice cream!  Yummy!
author: Miche P.

description: The free valet parking alone gets this place 3-star status. The fish is as fresh as any of the neighborhood Japanese restaurants like Zushi Puzzle and Asa. The rolls are slightly more creative than Zushi Puzzle (sorry Roger!) and there is never any wait here, free fresh edamame and free ice cream dessert.
author: Mama L.

description: For the price, Wasabi and Ginger offers some of the best and freshest sushi I've had in SF.  I order take out pretty frequently and they usually have it ready in 20 minutes.
author: Anne B.

description: This is my favorite sushi restaurant near Polk St, but it falls a little below the quality of sushi you can get elsewhere in the city.  This place beats Sushi Rock soundly.  The Unago Roll (Unagi/Mango) is a very tasty option.
author: Luke P.

description: Great sushi!  The rolls are the best.  I always get the Crazy and Lucky Rolls and the Super Dynamite is also great.  They give you edname and ice cream for free and they also have free valet.  All nice touches but I keep coming back for the rolls.  Check out the special board too.  This place is a winner winner sushi dinner!!!
author: B K.

description: It's an ok sushi place.  It's more of an everyday place for us to go, to fit in our Chinese, Thai, Afghani, Vietnamese routine.
author: jessica d.

description: All time favorite sushi place. I love the crazy and super dynamite rolls. The avocado and asparagas maki rolls are delicious along with the vegetarian dragon roll.
author: Molly B.

description: they had me at free edamame and ice cream, but the sushi is also delish and sake bombing is dangerously too affordable! free valet is a perk...
author: Andrea D.

description: I have eaten here three times now and i have not been disappointed yet. I love love love sushi and eat it all the time and have tried tons of places, and this one is up there...Its not the BEST sushi I have ever eaten, but the combo of the fish quality, price, and huge selection totally won me over!
author: Lauren Q.

description: Ok- how many sushi places deliver in the city and you never have to question how fresh the fish is? I LOVE Wasabi and Ginger bc they deliver great tasting sushi every time. I wouldn't say this is the best sushi in SF, but definitely the best delivery sushi in SF. The hamachi is always delicious and fresh, and they have tasty specialty rolls as well. Delivery is prompt and phone service is great. A must try!
author: nony s.

description: This place has a giant demitasse of Jolly Ranchers in the waiting area!  That's a winner! The sushi is decent for the price and you can get the white toro on most days..and not for the 40 dollar price tag for 4 pieces at certain spendy places *starts with "O"..ends with "O". If you're not adventurous there are teriyaki and other fried miscellaneous foods. The sushi is innovative and the presentation is impressive.  And for the sports junkies there is a TV there and everytime I've been there some sort of sporting event has been on. Yummmmmy...=9
author: Victoria W.

description: Good sushi, bad ambiance.  This little gem is "tucked away" on a very busy corner of Van Ness and Vallejo.   W&S seems to be good enough to have shrugged off the curse of this revolving restaurant corner.  Both eat in and take out are very good.  All the waiters are very friendly and helpful. Never crowded and always yummy.   Like all sushi places, it's not cheap.  I'm always amazed at the amount of cash I can blow eating uncooked fish.
author: mary w.

description: This is my neighborhood sushi restaurant for sure. Always delicious (especially the salmon). BUT, ALWAYS the same music. at 7:15 you will be hearing Avril Lavigne. Mark. My. Words. Eventually followed by Beyonce and a boy band or two. That is my only complaint, people :) The food is delish, and the people who work there are very friendly and attentive.
author: lady l.
